0.title: US will cross red line if it sends longer-range missiles to Ukraine: Russia
0.article_body: Russia's Foreign Ministry has said that the US would cross a "red line" and become "a party to the conflict" if it sends longer-range missiles to Ukraine. Moscow "reserves the right to defend its territory", it added. The US has already provided Ukraine with advanced GMLRS rockets fired from HIMARS launchers, which can hit targets up to 80 km away.

1.title: Hydrogen peroxide leaks from truck carrying containers in Pune
1.article_body: Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority's fire brigade responded to a leak of hydrogen peroxide from a truck which was carrying containers of the chemical on a highway in Shindewadi on Friday. The leak possibly occurred due to pressure from the containers kept above, a fire officer said. "We used water sprays to dilute...leaked chemical as per...guidelines," the fire officer added.

2.title: Bihar Police arrests all 4 accused in Begusarai firing case
2.article_body: Bihar Police has arrested all four accused in the Begusarai firing case. The accused persons have been identified as Keshav, Sumit, Yuvraj and Arjun. The firing incident led to the death of one person and at least nine others were injured. The bike-borne assailants had opened fire on random people at multiple locations in Begusarai.

3.title: TN tells HC it won't return leased elephants including Joymala to Assam
3.article_body: After Assam government filed a PIL, Tamil Nadu government told Madras High Court that it won't return the leased elephants, including Joymala, to Assam government. This comes following allegations that Joymala was being tortured at a temple in Tamil Nadu. Earlier, environment ministry shared a video of Joymala and supported Tamil Nadu government's claim that the elephant was doing well.

4.title: PM's plan to derail Bharat Jodo Yatra: Congress on ED summons to Shivakumar
4.article_body: After Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar received summons from the Enforcement Directorate (ED), party leader Jairam Ramesh criticised PM Modi, alleging that it was part of his tactics to derail the Bharat Jodo Yatra. "But he (PM Modi) won't succeed," Jairam tweeted. "Such cowardly acts will strengthen our resolve to decimate the corrupt Bommai...government," Randeep Singh Surjewala said.

5.title: ED freezes ₹46 crore kept in payment gateway accounts in Chinese loan apps case
5.article_body: The ED has detected and frozen funds worth ₹46.67 crore kept in payment gateways Paytm, Easebuzz, Razorpay and Cashfree Payments after recent raids in the Chinese loan apps case. The agency had conducted searches at six premises in Delhi, Ghaziabad, Mumbai, Lucknow, Gaya under PMLA, 2002, on Wednesday. The investigation was conducted against app-based token named HPZ and related entities.

6.title: I know nothing about Brahmāstra 2, want Ayan to see where Junoon goes: Mouni
6.article_body: Actress Mouni Roy has stated that she wants 'Brahmāstra' director Ayan Mukerji to put his thought into where her character Junoon goes after the first film. She added that she knows nothing about part two. "Ayan [came to me on set and told] me to not forget my connection to Shiv ji and Junoon's devotion to Brahmadev," the actress said.

7.title: I don't know if I'm that graceful: Sara on playing Sharmila in her biopic
7.article_body: Actress Sara Ali Khan was recently asked if she could portray her grandmother veteran actress Sharmila Tagore in her biopic. She said, "She's so graceful. I don't know if I'm graceful...She's so well-read...such a classy lady and she's had such a life." The actress further said that she has spent more time talking to her about worldviews than her craft.

8.title: CMs of Assam and Mizoram to hold talks on Monday over border dispute
8.article_body: Chief Minister of Assam Himanta Biswa Sarma and his Mizoram counterpart Zoramthanga will hold the second round of talks in New Delhi on Monday to settle the border dispute between the two states. Mizoram shares a 164.6-km border with Assam and the dispute over it is linked to colonial demarcations in 1875 and 1933.

9.title: Teacher thrashes 14-yr-old student for asking to go to toilet in UP
9.article_body: A 14-year-old Dalit student was allegedly thrashed by a teacher for seeking permission to go to the toilet in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor. According to police, the teacher denied the permission initially and when asked for the second time, he beat up the student with a stick, leaving him unconscious. The teacher was arrested and booked under the SC/ST Act.

10.title: Violent protests erupt after man dies in police custody in UP
10.article_body: Violent protests erupted after an electrician, 22-year-old Dev Narayan Yadav called for questioning in a murder case, died in police custody in Uttar Pradesh's Gonda. The protesters reportedly vandalised multiple police vehicles and a petrol pump, and attacked policemen. They demanded immediate arrest of those responsible and a financial assistance of ₹50 lakh for the victim's family.

11.title: Gautam Adani becomes 2nd richest man in the world as per Forbes
11.article_body: Adani Group's Chairperson Gautam Adani's wealth surged to make him the second richest man in the world on Friday, according to the Forbes' billionaire's list. While the richest man Elon Musk's net worth stood at $273.5 billion, Adani's net worth rose to $154.7 billion followed by Bernard Arnault and family's $153.8 billion and Jeff Bezos' $149.7 billion, as per Forbes.

12.title: I'm worried about content in mainstream Hindi cinema: Pankaj Tripathi
12.article_body: Actor Pankaj Tripathi said he is worried about the kind of content that is being made in mainstream Hindi cinema. "My taste in cinema is very different. I watch films like 'Thithi' and 'Court', I don't consume much mainstream Hindi content," he added. Pankaj further said that only a few South Indian films have been hits while the rest flopped.

13.title: Orange alert for Pune's Ghat areas today, rainfall till Saturday: IMD
13.article_body: India Meteorological Department (IMD) has issued an 'orange' alert for Pune's Ghat areas for Friday and added that very heavy rainfall is likely till Saturday. Pune city will receive moderate intensity rainfall on Friday and cloudy sky conditions will prevail throughout the day, IMD added. Pune's Lavasa received the highest rainfall of 104 mm in the last 24 hours.

14.title: There's no cancel culture in south, heard about it in B'wood: Dulquer
14.article_body: Speaking about the boycott Bollywood trends, actor Dulquer Salmaan stated that there is no cancel culture in the south and he heard about it first in Bollywood. He added that the trend is overpowering these days because of social media. "You can write anything, so people start writing things with their own agendas without any responsibilities," the actor said.

15.title: Criticism is audience's right, but 'Brahmāstra' set fire to box office: Alia
15.article_body: Reacting to the negative reviews of 'Brahmāstra', actress Alia Bhatt said that it is the audience's right, adding that she hopes the positives are more than the negatives. "Positive hi zyada hai varna jo box office pe aag lagayi hai voh hota nahi (It seems more positive otherwise the film won't have set fire to the box office)," she added.

16.title: Gautam Adani briefly becomes 2nd richest man in the world as per Forbes
16.article_body: Adani Group's Chairperson Gautam Adani's wealth surged to briefly make him the second richest man in the world on Friday, according to the Forbes' billionaire's list. He had briefly surpassed the net worth of Bernard Arnault and family ($155.2 billion), as per Forbes. Adani, whose net worth stood over $154.8 billion, is ahead of Jeff Bezos' $149.7 billion, Forbes stated.

17.title: Congress workers demand ₹2,000 from Kerala vendor for 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', threaten him
17.article_body: Three Congress workers have been suspended for threatening a vegetable vendor in Kerala's Kollam after he did not pay ₹2,000 as a donation to the ongoing 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'. Kerala Congress president K Sudhakaran said the party was "crowdfunding small donations voluntarily", and the workers' behaviour was "inexcusable". A video of the incident surfaced on social media.

18.title: World's oldest heart found in 380-million-year-old fish in Australia, say researchers
18.article_body: Researchers from Australia's Curtin University discovered a 380-million-year-old heart preserved inside a fossilised prehistoric fish, claiming it to be the world's oldest heart. The researchers also found fossilised stomach, intestine and liver in the ancient jawed fish. The discovery is remarkable as the fish's soft tissues were rarely preserved, said lead researcher Professor Kate Trinajstic.

19.title: Shama Sikander reveals she faced casting couch, says 'This concept is lowest of low'
19.article_body: Revealing that she faced casting couch, TV actress Shama Sikander said, "I have had producers tell me that they wanted to be friends with me. I was like, how can we be friends if we do not work together." "I feel the whole concept of asking for sex in return for work is the lowest of low," she added.

20.title: Tharoor shares pic with Federer, says 'My favourite tennis star after Amritraj'
20.article_body: Shashi Tharoor took to Twitter to share a picture with Roger Federer after the tennis legend announced retirement. "My favourite tennis star after Vijay Amritraj. Sad," Tharoor tweeted. "I saw Federer playing live at the 2003 Australian Open; he lost in the QF but impressed me more than the victor," he added.

21.title: Hungary can no longer be considered a full democracy: EU Parliament
21.article_body: Hungary can no longer be considered a "full democracy" and EU needs to do everything to bring it back into line with European values, the European Parliament said on Thursday. As many as 433 Members of European Parliament (MEPs) voted in favour of a resolution to describe Hungary, ruled by PM Viktor Orban, as "a hybrid regime of electoral autocracy".

22.title: Vedanta shares fall 6% after firm's clarification on chip plant
22.article_body: Vedanta Limited's shares fell by 6% on Friday after the Anil Agarwal-led company issued a clarification that the proposed Vedanta-Foxconn semiconductors business will be undertaken by Vedanta's ultimate holding company, Volcan Investments Limited, and not Vedanta. At 12.10 am, its stock was trading 6.2% lower at ₹294.6 apiece on the NSE. Volcan is wholly owned by the Agarwal family trust.

23.title: Medical college in Ahmedabad to be renamed after PM Modi
23.article_body: The Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation (AMC) has decided to rename a medical college after PM Narendra Modi. The civic body-run AMC MET Medical College will be known as 'Narendra Modi Medical College', announced AMC's Standing Committee Chairman Hitesh Barot. The proposal to rename the college, which was sent by the executive committee of AMC MET on September 14, has been cleared.

24.title: New T'gana secretariat complex to be named after BR Ambedkar: CM KCR
24.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Thursday decided to name the state's new secretariat complex, which is currently under construction, after BR Ambedkar. "Ambedkar's spirit guides us in implementing the federal spirit," KCR said on the decision. He further added that he would write a letter to PM Modi requesting him to name the new Parliament building after Ambedkar.

25.title: Govt revises definition of 'small' firms, doubles threshold for paid-up capital
25.article_body: The Ministry of Corporate Affairs has revised the definition of 'small' companies, doubling the threshold for paid-up capital and turnover to not exceeding ₹4 crore and ₹40 crore, respectively. With this change, the 'small' companies will not need to prepare cash flow statement as part of the financial statement and can hold only two board meetings in a year.

26.title: 12-member task force formed to control lumpy skin disease in Maharashtra
26.article_body: In order to control lumpy skin disease in the state, the Maharashtra government has formed a 12-member task force. It will be led by Pune's Commissioner of Animal Husbandry department. The task force members are authorised to hold meetings with the department's officials of affected districts and representatives of vaccine producers for lumpy skin disease.

27.title: Himachal to name 1 college library in each district after Ambedkar
27.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Cabinet on Thursday decided to name one library in a college in every district across the state as 'Dr Bhim Rao Ambedkar District Library' as a mark of respect for the Founder of the Indian Constitution. The state cabinet also expressed its gratitude to the Centre and BJP's national leaders for according Scheduled Tribe status to Hatti community.

28.title: PM Modi poses with China's Xi, Russia's Putin for group photo at SCO Summit
28.article_body: PM Narendra Modi posed for a group photo, along with Chinese President Xi Jinping, Russian President Vladimir Putin, Pakistan PM Shehbaz Sharif and other leaders, at the 22nd Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) Summit in Uzbekistan's Samarkand. He landed in Samarkand on Thursday night to take part in the summit. PM Modi is set to meet Russian President Putin on Friday.

29.title: Wanted to break TV while watching: Aaqib Javed on Pak's Asia Cup performance
29.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Aaqib Javed said he felt like "breaking his TV" while watching Pakistan's performances in Asia Cup 2022. "70% of [these] players don't deserve to play for Pakistan," he added. Discussing Pakistan's squad for T20 World Cup 2022, Aaqib stated, "[The selectors] have made mistakes...Pakistan will be the first team...in...T20 World Cup whose number four hasn't...won a game."

30.title: First visuals of Namibian cheetahs arriving in India on PM Modi's birthday surface
30.article_body: Videos showing first look of cheetahs that will be arriving in Madhya Pradesh from Namibia on PM Narendra Modi's birthday on Saturday have surfaced online. As many as eight cheetahs will be arriving from the country and PM Modi will release them in Kuno National Park. A special plane has been sent to Namibia to bring the cheetahs.

31.title: Over 50 ex-bureaucrats write to ECI seeking de-recognition of AAP
31.article_body: Over 50 retired bureaucrats have written to the Election Commission of India (ECI) seeking de-recognition of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) for inducing public servants to work for the party in Gujarat. "His (Kejriwal's) appeal to drivers...of public transport corporations and police personnel to work for a particular party is very wrong," said former Karnataka Additional Chief Secretary, M Madan Gopal.

32.title: Rahul watches Kathakali as Bharat Jodo Yatra resumes from Kollam
32.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi watched an artist perform Kathakali during his party's Bharat Jodo Yatra, which resumed from Polayathodu in Kerala's Kollam district on Friday. Gandhi is expected to interact with workers, entrepreneurs and others at Neendakara today. The foot march, which aims to cover 3,570 km from Kanniyakumari to Kashmir in 150 days, was launched on September 7.

33.title: Texas sends 2 buses of migrants to US Vice President Harris' home
33.article_body: Texas Governor Greg Abbott on Thursday said he has intentionally sent two migrant buses carrying over 100 people to US Vice President Kamala Harris' residence in Washington DC. "Texas will continue sending migrants to sanctuary cities like Washington DC until President [Joe] Biden and Border Czar Harris step up and do their jobs to secure the border," he added.

34.title: Pic showing comet's tail being torn away by powerful solar wind wins photography prize
34.article_body: A rare photograph of a comet that will never be seen from the Earth again has won the Astronomy Photographer of the Year Competition in the 'Planets, Comets and Asteroids' category. The image, which was captured by Gerald Rhemann, shows a piece of Comet Leonard's tail breaking off and being carried away by a powerful solar wind.

35.title: Rahul Gandhi doesn't have knowledge of northeast: Pema Khandu
35.article_body: Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister Pema Khandu dismissed Rahul Gandhi's claims of Chinese incursion and claimed that the Congress MP does not have much knowledge about the northeast. "Saw on social media that Chinese entered (Indian side) and are constructing again...The Opposition's claims are wrong. I say confidently there's no Chinese intrusion in Arunachal," said Khandu.

36.title: The way they lost, it hurts: Miandad on Pak's Asia Cup final defeat
36.article_body: Discussing Pakistan's loss against Sri Lanka in Asia Cup 2022 final, Javed Miandad said, "Players will benefit from my presence...The way they lost, it hurts." Expressing his anger at PCB for not including ex-Pakistan players in the team setup, Miandad added, "It's...shameful. You've so many people...where's your nationalism?" "These kids...just go...and start hitting," he stated.

37.title: I am not scared of anything: Azad on death threats by terrorists
37.article_body: Reacting to the reports of death threats by terrorists, former J&K CM Ghulam Nabi Azad claimed that he is not scared of anything. "I heard about the reports that terrorists have issued a threat to kill me. They have said I met Amit Shah and Ajit Doval before coming here. I have never met Doval in my life," he said.

38.title: Pune residents sit in potholes in protest, seek urgent repairs
38.article_body: Residents in Pune on Thursday staged a protest near Bhekrai Nagar chowk over potholes on roads causing accidents, with some protesters even sitting in the potholes. The residents have also sought urgent repairs on the roads. A father-daughter duo had died on a potholed road while on the way to drop the girl at school, the protesters claimed.

39.title: 15-year-old Thane girl claims she was forced to marry, tortured
39.article_body: A case was filed against four people in Thane after a 15-year-old girl claimed that she was forcibly married to a man who then sexually exploited and tortured her, an official said. The girl had shifted to Muzaffarpur with the man, however, when she came back to her parents in Thane, she told them about her ordeal, the official said.

40.title: ED conducts raids at 40 locations across India in Delhi excise policy case
40.article_body: Enforcement Directorate on Friday morning conducted raids at 40 locations spread across multiple states in connection with the Delhi excise policy case. Raids are underway at premises linked to liquor businessmen, distributors and others in multiple cities including Hyderabad, Bengaluru and Chennai. ED earlier conducted searches on September 6 at about 45 locations across India.

41.title: SRK came to our house at 4:30am after 'Baazigar' win: Abbas-Mustan
41.article_body: Filmmaking duo Abbas-Mustan revealed that Shah Rukh Khan came to their house at 4:30 in the morning after winning the Best Actor Filmfare Award for 1993 film 'Baazigar'. They added that Shah Rukh came along with Anu Malik and Ratan Jain among others. "Shah Rukh...hugged us and said...'I cannot go home with this trophy before taking your blessings'," they said.

42.title: 1,000 litres of adulterated milk seized in Mumbai's Dharavi, 6 arrested
42.article_body: The police on Thursday busted an adulteration racket in Mumbai's Dharavi and seized around 1010 litres of adulterated milk. Based on a tip-off, police raided houses involved in such activities and arrested six persons. The accused allegedly bought milk packets from companies including Gokul and Amul and added water to them. They then sealed the packets with a candle flame.

43.title: ATP shares pic of Roger Federer crying after French Open 2009 win, says 'Us right now'
43.article_body: Following the news of Roger Federer's retirement, ATP shared a picture of Federer crying after winning the French Open 2009. "Us right now," ATP captioned the picture. "I remember this moment so clearly...tennis won't be the same without Roger!" a fan wrote. Federer won a total of 20 Grand Slams in his career.

44.title: Pak board not doing anything for Shaheen, he's spending own money: Shahid Afridi on rehab
44.article_body: Former Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi has claimed that Pakistan Cricket Board is not doing anything for fast bowler Shaheen Afridi's injury rehab. "He went to England [for the rehab] on his own. He bought his own ticket, he spent his own money to stay in a hotel. I arranged a doctor for him," Shahid said.

45.title: 'Uber has suffered a data breach,' hacker tells employees; company starts probe
45.article_body: Uber's computer network suffered a breach on Thursday, leading the company to take several of its internal communications and engineering systems offline. A hacker compromised an Uber employee's Slack account and used it to send the message saying, "I am a hacker and Uber has suffered a data breach." Uber is investigating the breach, a company spokesperson said.

46.title: Karnataka Legislative Council passes anti-conversion bill amid protest
46.article_body: Karnataka Legislative Council on Thursday passed the Protection of Right to Freedom of Religion Bill, 2021 or the "anti-conversion bill", by a voice vote. "Amendments [to the bill] made to ensure forceful conversions stopped. We are passing this bill to protect religion and faith," state Law Minister JC Madhuswamy said. Congress staged a walkout while the bill was being tabled.

47.title: BitGo sues Galaxy Digital for $100 mn for terminating $1.2 bn deal
47.article_body: Crypto financial services firm, Galaxy Digital Holdings Limited, was sued by digital asset custodian BitGo Inc for at least $100 million in damages for terminating a $1.2-billion takeover deal. According to the lawsuit filed by BitGo, Galaxy Digital falsely blamed its accounting, whereas it was grappling with a collapse of digital currencies. Galaxy will seek to have the lawsuit dismissed.

48.title: Promise of bigger plant for Maharashtra is like consoling a child: Pawar
48.article_body: NCP President Sharad Pawar criticised Maharashtra CM for losing the Vedanta-Foxconn project to Gujarat and said that Centre's assurance of a bigger project to Maharashtra was like consoling a child. "Since the project has already gone out of Maharashtra, there is no possibility of getting it back...CM must lead to creating a favourable environment for the investors," Pawar said.

49.title: Indian-origin 'werewolf killer' who stabbed US man 50 times joins dating app; pic surfaces
49.article_body: Pankaj Bhasin, an Indian-origin man called 'werewolf killer' after stabbing a US man 50 times due to a psychiatric break four years ago, recently joined a dating site. After taking note, a US court ordered him to stay off social media till he's on conditional release. Bhasin is free on conditional release after spending three years in mental health facility.

50.title: Boeing will not sell 737 Max jets to China, to find new buyers
50.article_body: Boeing said it will not deliver some Boeing 737 Max jets that were built for Chinese airlines as China's aviation regulator has not cleared the plane to fly after two fatal crashes. It will instead find new buyers. Boeing had an inventory of 290 undelivered 737s as of June 30, out of which almost half was earmarked for China.

51.title: YouTuber Savukku Shankar gets 6-month jail for calling judiciary corrupt
51.article_body: Holding popular YouTuber Savukku Shankar guilty of criminal contempt for his remarks against the judiciary, the Madras High Court on Thursday sentenced him to six months imprisonment. In an interview, Shankar had said that the "entire higher judiciary is plagued by corruption". The judges said that they would have spared him had he realised his mistake and sincerely apologised.

52.title: I'm proud of breaking up with Kanye, he had a lot to work on: Julia
52.article_body: Actress-model Julia Fox said she is proud of breaking up with rapper Kanye West, adding he has a lot of unresolved issues he was dealing with. "It just seems like he had a lot to work on...I just don't have time for it," she added. Julia further said she would have stuck it out before the birth of her son.

53.title: Pakistan is moving around with a begging bowl in hand today: Pakistan PM
53.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif publicly admitted that his country is moving around with a begging bowl in hand today as it has failed to progress economically despite 75 years of independence. "Today, when we go to any friendly country or make a phone call, they think that we have come to beg for money," he said.

54.title: Manipur CM appeals for peace talks as 13 insurgents lay down arms
54.article_body: Manipur CM N Biren Singh on Thursday appealed to all militant outfits to come for peace talks after 13 insurgents surrendered before him in Imphal. Of the insurgents who surrendered, 12 were from KCP-PWG and one was from KYKL. The militants laid down arms, including two grenade launchers, three pistols, two detonators and two radio sets, among others, PTI reported.

55.title: I've always compared Mahmudullah with MS Dhoni: Ex-India bowler Sriram
55.article_body: Ex-India bowler and Bangladesh coach Sridharan Sriram said he's "always compared" Mahmudullah Riyad with MS Dhoni considering his performances. "Mahmudullah...finished a lot of matches for Bangladesh," added Sriram. Talking about his conversation with Mahmudullah over not being a part of Bangladesh's squad for T20 World Cup 2022, Sriram stated, "It is never...easy...I've to be the bad man."

56.title: GMDA to construct road overbridge at Gurugram's Palam Vihar
56.article_body: The Gurugram Metropolitan Development Authority (GMDA) will construct a road overbridge connecting Gurugram's Palam Vihar and Sector 102 road with the Dwarka expressway. Residents living in Palam Vihar, Sectors 21, 22 and 23, along with people travelling from Delhi to Udyog Vihar and beyond will benefit from the project. The overbridge will be built at a cost of ₹68 crore.

57.title: Ex-US teacher charged with sex crimes after posting TikToks of students
57.article_body: A former elementary school teacher in US' Tennessee has been charged with 19 sex crimes, including rape and sexual battery by an authority figure, after allegedly posting inappropriate videos of her students on TikTok. However, the exact content of the videos has not been revealed yet. Taylor Cruze, who resigned as a fifth-grade teacher in May, was arrested in August.

58.title: Telugu industry is dominated by film families & their fans: Amala Paul
58.article_body: Speaking about leaving the Telugu film industry, actress Amala Paul stated that it is dominated by film families and their fans. "There would always be two actresses and we'd be there for the love scenes, songs and everything was very glamorous," the actress added. She further said they were very commercial films and she couldn't connect much with the industry.

59.title: J&K to declare Maharaja Hari Singh's birthday a public holiday
59.article_body: The birth anniversary of Maharaja Hari Singh, the last ruler of the erstwhile princely state of Jammu and Kashmir, will be declared a public holiday, according to an official statement. Lieutenant Governor Manoj Sinha announced the decision after meeting with prominent political leaders, civil society members and others. Singh was a great educationist and a social reformer, said Sinha.

60.title: I told Babar 'Don't take up captaincy, reach Kohli's level first': Kamran
60.article_body: Sharing his conversation with Babar Azam after Babar was named as Pakistan's captain, Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Kamran Akmal said, "I told him, 'I don't think now is the right time for you to become captain'." "Reach Virat Kohli's level first...I told him back in the day but it was his decision," added Kamran elaborating on his advice to Babar.

61.title: CBI seeks WB leader Partha's custody in recruitment scam case
61.article_body: The CBI has filed a plea in a Kolkata court seeking custody of former West Bengal Education Minister Partha Chatterjee in connection with the teachers' recruitment scam. "During interrogation, the five persons arrested by our officers revealed a lot of information, which clearly points at the role of the former Education Minister in the matter," said a CBI official.

62.title: I was listed as a billionaire, it pissed me off: Founder who donated US-based firm
62.article_body: Patagonia Founder Yvon Chouinard, who has donated his US-based company to fight climate change, said, "I was in Forbes magazine listed as a billionaire, which really, really pissed me off." The 83-year-old told The New York Times, "I don't have $1 billion in...bank. I don't drive Lexuses." Chouinard founded Patagonia 49 years ago and is valued at $3 billion today.

63.title: Hyderabad Metro was initially written off as a foolish idea, says MD
63.article_body: Hyderabad Metro Managing Director NVS Reddy on Thursday said, "The metro projects were originally written off by many experts as a foolish idea and a jinxed project." He was speaking as the Chief Guest at an Engineer's Day event at Anurag University. Citing the metro's example, Reddy encouraged students to be innovative, confident and to learn to face challenges.

64.title: Unfortunate, but he's happy: Nagarjuna on Samantha-Naga Chaitanya divorce
64.article_body: Veteran actor Nagarjuna has called his son Naga Chaitanya's divorce with actress Samantha Ruth Prabhu unfortunate, saying that it's an experience that happened to his son. "We can't keep moping about it. It's gone. It's out of our lives," the actor said. Nagarjuna further said his son is happy and that's all he sees, adding that's good enough for him.

65.title: 7-yr-old dies after falling into pit at Pune construction site; 4 booked
65.article_body: A seven-year-old boy died after falling into a pit filled with rainwater at a construction site in Pune's Wagholi. The deceased's uncle on Wednesday lodged the first information report (FIR) at the Lonikand Police Station. Police have booked four persons of a construction firm under various sections of the Indian Penal Code.

66.title: Blake Lively, Ryan Reynolds expecting their 4th child; pic shows actress with baby bump
66.article_body: Hollywood actress Blake Lively and actor Ryan Reynolds, who have three daughters James (7), Inez (5), and Betty (2), are expecting their fourth child. Pictures from Blake's appearance at the Forbes Power Women's Summit showed her with a baby bump. "I just like to create. Whether that's baking or storytelling or businesses or humans," the actress said at the event.

67.title: Hydrogen-powered trains to be ready by 2023: Railways Minister
67.article_body: Railways Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw while speaking at a university in Odisha's Bhubaneswar, said on Thursday that India is developing hydrogen-powered trains and they will be ready by next year. He also added that the Vande Bharat Express, which is the country's first indigenous semi-high speed train, "has been running smoothly without any major breakdown for the last two years".

68.title: Jimmy Neesham declines New Zealand central contract
68.article_body: All-rounder Jimmy Neesham has declined a central contract offered to him by New Zealand Cricket. "I know...news of my decision to decline a central contract...will be seen as me choosing money over representing my country," Neesham said. He added, "I had planned to accept...offer in July...however since being left off the list I've committed to other leagues around the world."

69.title: Sensex falls 400 points, Nifty below 17,800 in opening trade
69.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the red on Friday amid weak global cues. The Sensex fell over 400 points to trade at 59,533, while the Nifty lost over 100 points to open below 17,800. Tech Mahindra, M&M, Wipro, Maruti Suzuki, Infosys and TCS were among the major losers. Stocks of Sun Pharma, Bajaj Finance and Asian Paints gained.

70.title: Supplying weapons to Ukraine morally acceptable: Pope Francis
70.article_body: Pope Francis said that it is "morally acceptable" for countries to provide weapons to Ukraine to help the country defend itself from Russian aggression. "It can be immoral if the intention is provoking more war," he added. Pope also urged Ukraine to be open to dialogue, even though it may "smell" because it would be difficult for the Ukrainian side.

71.title: India reports 6,298 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 46,748
71.article_body: India has reported 6,298 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. The data showed that 5,916 people recovered in the last 24 hours following which the active COVID-19 cases in the country dropped to 46,748. This comes a day after 6,422 new COVID-19 cases were reported in India.

72.title: Bodies of 440 people found in a grave in city recaptured from Russia by Ukraine
72.article_body: Ukrainian authorities have found bodies of over 440 people in a grave in the city of Izium that was recaptured from Russian forces. Serhiy Bolvinov, the chief police investigator for Kharkiv region, said that forensic investigations would be carried out on every body. "Russia is leaving death behind it everywhere and must be held responsible," Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said.

73.title: COVID-19 cases in B'luru rise marginally to 283, 1 death reported
73.article_body: Bengaluru reported 283 new COVID-19 infections on Thursday, up from 261 seen a day before, taking the cumulative total to 18,69,524 cases, said BBMP Chief Commissioner. One more patient died of the infection, taking the total death toll to 16,987 in the city. The number of active cases was 2,463, while the infection positivity rate stood at 2.07%.

74.title: 9, including 3 minors, killed in Lucknow's Dilkusha as wall collapses amid heavy rain
74.article_body: As many as nine people, including three minors, were killed and two others were injured after a wall collapsed amid heavy rain in Lucknow. The incident took place in Dilkusha under Cantt, the state Home Department said. UP CM Yogi Adityanath has announced financial assistance of ₹4 lakh each to the families of the deceased.

75.title: Trader attacked, robbed in Delhi's Adarsh Nagar; 2 arrested
75.article_body: Two people have been arrested for attacking and robbing a 52-year-old trader in Delhi's Adarsh Nagar area on Wednesday. According to police, Harpreet Singh was walking towards his car when four assailants attacked him and robbed him of ₹34,500 in cash, along with his mobile phone and some cards. Police recovered robbed amount worth ₹16,500 from the accused's possession.

76.title: Burglar wanted in 20 cases held in Navi Mumbai; ₹28 lakh-gold recovered
76.article_body: Gold worth ₹28 lakh was recovered after a burglar who was wanted in 20 house break-in cases was arrested in Navi Mumbai, CP Bipin Kumar Singh said. The accused was traced after the weight of the gold he stole constantly caused his pants to slip off, which forced him to hire an auto from a stand that had CCTV.

77.title: Fire breaks out at chemical research centre in Hyderabad
77.article_body: A fire broke out at a chemical research centre in Hyderabad's Nacharam on Thursday. About 300 litres of chemicals were said to have been burnt in the incident, however, no casualties were reported. Three fire engines were deployed to contain the blaze. This comes days after a fire at an e-bike showroom in the city claimed eight lives.

78.title: Not inviting Russia to Queen Elizabeth II's funeral blasphemous: Moscow
78.article_body: Russia has described the UK's decision not to invite its representatives to Queen Elizabeth II's funeral as "blasphemous". "We see this British attempt to use the national tragedy...for geopolitical purposes to settle scores with our country...as deeply immoral," Russia's Foreign Ministry said. Relations between the two countries have been at a breaking point since Moscow began invading Ukraine.

79.title: Queen's relative faints as her coffin arrives in Westminster Hall; pic surfaces
79.article_body: UK Queen Elizabeth II's relative Lady Gabriella Windsor collapsed as the Queen's coffin arrived at the Westminster Hall for service. Lady Gabriella Windsor was seen being assisted to a seat by several people present at the service. Earlier, a Royal guard fainted and fell off the podium where he was protecting the Queen's coffin.

80.title: Building's wall falls on tin shed in Pimpri Chinchwad; 2 dead
80.article_body: Two people have died after a portion of a building's wall fell on the adjacent tin shed, in which they both were, during plastering work on Thursday in Pimpri Chinchwad's Moshi. A senior inspector said that two labourers who had climbed a bamboo structure for the plastering work were also injured during the incident when the structure collapsed.

81.title: NTA announces Common University Entrance Test-UG 2022 results
81.article_body: National Testing Agency (NTA) has announced the results of the first Common University Entrance Test-Undergraduate (CUET-UG) 2022. Students can check their scorecards at cuet.samarth.ac.in. NTA conducted CUET-UG 2022 in six phases in July-August at 489 centres in 259 cities across India. CUET is conducted for admission to undergraduate courses at central and other participating universities.

82.title: $30 billion wiped off Adobe's market value after $20 billion deal to buy Figma
82.article_body: Shares of Adobe plunged nearly 17% after the Photoshop maker announced a $20 billion cash and stock deal to buy online design startup Figma on Thursday. The biggest plunge in the company's stock since 2010 wiped out more than $30 billion from Adobe's market value. The deal has sparked some concerns among investors who argued that Adobe overpaid for Figma.

83.title: Elon Musk's ex-girlfriend auctions their college photos, gifts for over ₹1.3 crore
83.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk's ex-girlfriend Jennifer Gwynne has raised over $165,000 (₹1.3 crore) from the auction of photos and memorabilia gifted to her by Musk during their year-long relationship in 1994-95. A gold necklace with a green emerald that Musk gave to Gwynne as a birthday present sold for $51,000, whereas Musk's previously unseen photographs sold for up to $21,000.

84.title: Putin laughs as Pak PM struggles with headphones during meeting; video surfaces
84.article_body: A video showing Russian President Vladimir Putin laughing as Pakistan Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif struggles with headphones during bilateral talks has surfaced on social media. The video, which was shared by former Pakistan PM Imran Khan's party PTI, also showed Sharif asking an aide for help. Putin laughed as the device fell off Sharif's ear.

85.title: Parts of Bengaluru's Nalapad Academy demolished over encroachment
85.article_body: Days after the city witnessed massive flooding, the Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) on Wednesday demolished parts of Nalapad Academy, an international school near Embassy Golf Links Business Park. The school, owned by Congress MLA NA Haris, faced allegations of encroachment. Officials said that storm water drain passes through a part of the property.

86.title: Delhi AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan summoned by anti-corruption branch
86.article_body: The anti-corruption branch (ACB) issued a notice to Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leader Amanatullah Khan over allegations of illegal appointment in the Delhi Waqf Board. The Okhla MLA was called for questioning on Friday afternoon in connection with the Prevention of Corruption Act, 1988 case registered in 2020. ACB is probing alleged irregularities in recruitment in the Delhi Waqf board.

87.title: BMC to conduct sero-survey in Mumbai from Sept 15 to Oct 6
87.article_body: The BMC will conduct a sero-survey in Mumbai from September 15 to October 6, in order to check COVID-19 antibodies among healthcare and frontline workers. The civic body aims to collect 3,094 samples from 93 places and people, including hospitals, solid waste department and BEST employees. "It'll...help...understand the significance of the third dose of COVID-19 vaccine," an official said.

88.title: Croma Early Bird Sale offers daily deals on all electronics
88.article_body: Croma welcomes the festive season 2022 with its Early Bird Sale from 14th to 18th September. New deals are offered on Croma website and store every day on iPhones, Android smartphones, smartwatches, televisions & other electronics, for a limited period only. HDFC credit card users can avail up to 10% instant discount* and EasyEMI*.

89.title: Passenger with ₹88 lakh foreign currency in laptop bag held at Delhi airport
89.article_body: Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) officials nabbed a passenger carrying foreign currency worth approximately ₹88 lakh at Delhi's Indira Gandhi International Airport. The passenger had concealed the currency under a false layer in a 'laptop bag', CISF said while posting a video of the operation. The passenger was later handed over to customs officials.

90.title: 38-year-old ambulance driver shot dead in Delhi
90.article_body: A 38-year-old man, who worked as an ambulance driver, was shot dead on Thursday morning in South West Delhi, police said. Sunil was returning home from work on a motorcycle when two unidentified people, who were also riding a motorcycle, allegedly shot him. The murder was reported in Jaffarpur Kalan area on a road connecting Samaspur Khalsa and Kazipur villages.

91.title: BMTC planning to induct 10 double-decker AC electric buses
91.article_body: Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) is planning to induct 10 double-decker air-conditioned electric buses, said BMTC Director AV Surya Sen. "Of the 10, amount (for procurement) has been sanctioned for five. We are also in the process of identifying the routes," Sen added. The electric buses are likely to be operated on Outer Ring Road and other peripheral roads.

92.title: Australia's Rachael Haynes, who won 6 World Cups, retires from international cricket
92.article_body: Australia Women batter Rachael Haynes has announced her retirement from international cricket at the age of 35. She played six Tests, 77 ODIs and 84 T20Is in her career. She was part of Australia Women's 2010, 2012, 2018 and 2020 T20 World Cup-winning squads. She also won two ODI World Cups (2013 and 2022).

93.title: Your tennis became a habit and habits never retire: Sachin Tendulkar to Roger Federer
93.article_body: Penning a note on Roger Federer's retirement, Sachin Tendulkar wrote, "What a career, @rogerfederer. We fell in love with your brand of tennis." He added, "Slowly, your tennis became a habit. And habits never retire, they become a part of us." Sachin further wrote, "Thank you for all the wonderful memories." Federer won 20 Grand Slams during his career.

94.title: Dalit sisters were raped, strangulated in Lakhimpur Kheri: Autopsy report
94.article_body: The post-mortem report of the two Dalit girls who were found hanging from a tree in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri has confirmed that they were raped and murdered, police said. The report stated that the minor girls died due to strangulation. Police said that the accused hanged the victims to eliminate evidence of murder. Police have arrested six accused.

95.title: I wish this day would have never come: Rafael Nadal on Roger Federer's retirement
95.article_body: Reacting to Roger Federer announcing his retirement, Rafael Nadal tweeted, "Dear Roger, my friend and rival. I wish this day would have never come." He added, "It's a sad day for me personally and for sports around the world." He further wrote, "It's been a pleasure but also an honour and privilege to share all these years with you."

96.title: Chief selector's cheap selection: Mohammad Amir on Pakistan's T20 World Cup 2022 squad
96.article_body: Pakistani pacer Mohammad Amir took to Twitter to react to Pakistan's squad for T20 World Cup 2022 that was announced today. "Chief selector ki cheap selection (Chief selector's cheap selection)," he wrote. Reacting to it, a fan wrote, "You just sit and watch...Champions Trophy highlights." Amir announced his retirement from international cricket in December 2020 due to then PCB management.

97.title: 'Everybody fixing their bodies, nobody fixing their souls,' writes Deepika in new post
97.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone on Wednesday shared a post featuring pictures from Mijwan 2022, where she walked the ramp. Sharing the post, she wrote in the caption, "It's the last one for me." The last part of the post read, "Everybody is fixing their bodies, nobody fixing their souls." Reacting to this, an Instagram user commented, "Last slide is so true!"

98.title: Will give ED list of 100 TMC leaders with disproportionate assets: BJP MLA
98.article_body: BJP MLA Suvendu Adhikari on Thursday stated that he would soon submit documents to the ED that contain details about "disproportionate assets" of 100 Trinamool Congress (TMC) leaders. "A few days back, [West Bengal] CM Mamata Banerjee...claimed that 99% of party workers are honest. But, I've documents to prove [that] nearly 99% of TMC leaders are corrupt," Adhikari claimed.

99.title: Wife, lover electrocutes 26-year-old man to death in Maha; arrested
99.article_body: A 21-year-old woman, her lover and one more person have been arrested in connection with the murder of a 26-year-old lawyer in Maharashtra's Jalna, police said. Kiran Lokhande was killed after his wife and her lover allegedly gave him sleeping pills before electrocuting him. The accused had claimed that Kiran was killed in a blaze caused by gas leakage.

100.title: 16 TDP legislators suspended from Andhra Pradesh Assembly
100.article_body: Sixteen legislators of Telugu Desam Party (TDP) were suspended for a day in the Andhra Pradesh Legislative Assembly on Thursday for protesting in the Well of the House. The TDP members had allegedly taken offence to purported remarks made by Social Welfare Minister M Nagarjuna on Dalit MLA DBV Swamy. Minister Nagarjuna maintained he had said nothing wrong.

101.title: Speaking Hindi gives me shivers, I speak it with hesitation: FM
101.article_body: At an event organised by Hindi Vivek magazine on Thursday, Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said, "Addressing an audience in Hindi gives me shivers...I speak Hindi with...'sankoch' (hesitation)." She added that she attended college in Tamil Nadu amid an agitation against Hindi. Students opting for Hindi as the second language did not get scholarships by the state government then, she claimed.

102.title: Astronomers find evidence of Neptune or Saturn-like 'baby' planet in making
102.article_body: Astronomers believe planets are born in protoplanetary disks. Using a new technique, they have found evidence of a baby planet in the making in one such protoplanetary disk known as LkCa 15, located 518 light years away from Earth. The baby planet is roughly the size of Neptune or Saturn and around one to three million years old, astronomers stated.

103.title: China's Xi and Russia's Putin meet in Uzbekistan, discuss ties
103.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping and Russia’s Vladimir Putin discussed enhancing bilateral ties on the sidelines of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in Uzbekistan on Thursday. Putin launched a veiled criticism of the US, saying “attempts to create a unipolar world" have taken an "ugly shape". Xi said Russia and China will play a leading role in a "rapidly changing world".

104.title: AI startup Rephrase.ai raises $10.6 mn in Series A funding round
104.article_body: Artificial Intelligence startup Rephrase.ai, backed by Lightspeed Ventures, has raised $10.6 million in its Series A funding round. The round was led by Red Ventures and saw participation from Silver Lake and 8VC Ventures, among other investors. Founded in 2019 by IIT alumni Ashray Malhotra, Nisheeth Lahoti and Shivam Mangla, the startup is a synthetic media production platform.

105.title: US singer R Kelly convicted of child pornography charge
105.article_body: US singer R Kelly has been convicted of child pornography by a jury in Chicago. Of the 13 counts on trial, Kelly was found guilty on six counts. A count of child pornography carries a minimum sentence of five years in Chicago. Kelly is already serving a 30-year prison sentence after conviction in racketeering and sex trafficking charges.

106.title: IIT alumni's US-based startup raises $90 mn in funding round
106.article_body: Fortanix Inc, a US-based data security startup founded by IIT graduates, has raised $90 million in its Series C funding round led by Goldman Sachs Group Inc fund. The round also saw participation from Giantleap Capital and existing investors such as Intel Capital. The startup was founded in 2016 by IIT Kanpur alumni Ambuj Kumar and Anand Kashyap.

107.title: Indian-American Shefali Duggal appointed US' Ambassador to the Netherlands
107.article_body: Indian-American political activist Shefali Razdan Duggal has been appointed the US' next Ambassador to the Netherlands. Duggal's nomination was confirmed by the US Senate in a voice vote. Duggal, 50, is a Kashmiri Pandit. She was born in Haridwar and shifted to Pennsylvania, US, with her family when she was two years old.

108.title: UK to observe 2-min national silence during Queen's state funeral
108.article_body: The UK will observe two-minute national silence during Queen Elizabeth II’s state funeral on Monday, the Buckingham Palace said. Releasing details of the funeral arrangements, the palace said Elizabeth’s coffin will be taken from Westminster Abbey to Wellington Arch on a horse-drawn gun carriage. The funeral will be attended by around 2,000 guests, including people the Queen had honoured.

109.title: NASA's supernova remnant image gives clues about its star’s death
109.article_body: Astronomers studying the remains of a supernova captured using NASA telescopes have found clues about the star's death. The supernova remnant called SNR 0519-69.0 is the debris from an explosion of a white dwarf star, which according to NASA's Chandra Ray Observatory, underwent a thermonuclear explosion after reaching critical mass. It's located in a small galaxy called Large Magellanic Cloud.

110.title: Ex-President of WBBSE Kalyanmoy Ganguly arrested in SSC scam case
110.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) on Thursday arrested Kalyanmoy Ganguly, former President of West Bengal Board of Secondary Education (WBBSE), in connection with the state SSC recruitment scam case. Ganguly was arrested after being questioned by CBI officials. Earlier in the day, the CBI raided the offices of two software companies in connection with the case.

111.title: Gems, jewellery exports grew by 6.7% in August to ₹26,418 crore
111.article_body: The overall gems and jewellery exports grew by 6.7% in August 2022 to ₹26,418.84 crore as compared to ₹24,749.69 crore in the same period last year, the Gem and Jewellery Export Promotion Council (GJEPC) said on Thursday. However, the overall gross export of cut and polished diamonds (CPD) declined 0.84% to ₹14,955.8 crore in August.

112.title: BJP paid ₹40-50 cr to each of 8 Goa Cong MLAs: AICC Goa in-charge
112.article_body: After eight Goa Congress MLAs joined BJP, AICC Goa in-charge Dinesh Gundu Rao on Thursday accused the BJP of paying ₹40-50 crore to each legislator. "The national party (BJP) is doing such things everywhere. Where is all this money coming from?" Gundu Rao questioned. "They are misusing the power. They are breaking the elected representatives," Rao said.

113.title: Nigeria’s consumer inflation hit 17-year high in August 2022
113.article_body: The Nigerian National Bureau of Statistics on Thursday said the country's consumer inflation rose to its highest level in 17 years in August 2022. As per official data, inflation rose to 20.5% in August, up from 19.6% in July this year. This is the seventh straight month wherein Nigeria has recorded an increase in its inflation rate.

114.title: Thief dangles from train window for 10 km in Bihar as passengers grab his arms
114.article_body: A man trying to snatch a mobile phone from a train passenger through the window was left hanging outside for 10 km, apologising, as passengers grabbed his arms. The video is from Bihar and the train was reportedly nearing the end of its journey from Begusarai to Khagaria. The passengers let him go when the train was close to Khagaria.

115.title: BJP 'gifts' 5 autos to Kejriwal after his run-in with Guj police
115.article_body: Delhi BJP MLAs reached Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's residence to offer him a 'gift' of 5 autorickshaws after his argument with Gujarat police over being stopped from getting in the three-wheeler. In Gujarat, Kejriwal had an argument with policemen in his security detail about getting into an auto owing to security concerns. Kejriwal was going to the auto driver's home.

116.title: What was gangster Lawrence Bishnoi's 'Plan B' to kill Salman Khan?
116.article_body: Members of the Goldie Brar-Lawrence Bishnoi gang had rented a room in Panvel to recce Salman Khan's farmhouse. The gangsters managed to track down the route and judging by the potholes, they surmised that the actor's car could be travelling at around 25 kmph. Bishnoi's men also befriended the security guards at the farmhouse by pretending to be his fans.

117.title: World number one Alcaraz reacts to Federer's retirement with broken heart emoji
117.article_body: World number one men's tennis player Carlos Alcaraz, who recently stated he'd like to face Roger Federer, reacted to Federer's retirement with a broken heart emoji. He tweeted, "Roger...[broken heart emoji]." In another tweet, he wrote, "Roger has been one of my idols...Thank you for everything you have done for our sport...I still want to play with you!"

118.title: Video shows monkey attending classes with kids at J'khand govt school
118.article_body: A video showing a monkey attending classes and prayer meetings with students at a Jharkhand government school has gone viral on social media. As per reports, the monkey has been attending classes for the past one week. The headmaster said that the monkey reaches the school premises when the school opens at 9:00 am and leaves after the classes end.

119.title: Shell to deploy over 10,000 EV charging points across India by 2030
119.article_body: Energy company Shell has said that it plans to install over 10,000 electric vehicle (EV) charging points across India by 2030 through Shell Recharge Stations. Shell launched its first EV chargers in India for the four-wheeler and two-wheeler segments in Bangalore on Thursday. The company said that the electricity used by Shell Recharge chargers will be 100% green energy.

120.title: Scientists claim to have discovered a rare 'dinosaur mummy' in Canada
120.article_body: Scientists claim they've discovered a rare 'dinosaur mummy' in Canada, said to be one of the most well-preserved dinosaur fossils ever found. The remains of the hadrosaur, a duck-billed, large-bodied, herbivorous dinosaur, included a large portion of its tail and right hind foot. Large parts of its exposed skeleton are covered in fossilised skin, which makes it unique, scientists said.

121.title: Interstate gang of bike thieves busted in Ambala; 3 held, 16 bikes seized
121.article_body: The Haryana Police busted an interstate gang of motorcycle thieves and arrested three accused including a mechanic from Ambala. Sixteen motorcycles were recovered from them, a police spokesperson said on Thursday. During interrogation, one of the accused confessed that he had been working as a motorcycle mechanic and stole them to raise money to pay for drugs, the spokesperson added.

122.title: Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi had 'Plan B' to kill Salman Khan: Police
122.article_body: Gangster Lawrence Bishnoi had a 'Plan B' to kill actor Salman Khan, the police in Delhi and Punjab have said. Punjab Police revealed that the plan was led by Kapil Pandit, a shooter of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, who was recently arrested. Pandit and his associates had rented a room in Panvel to recce a farmhouse that Salman owned.

123.title: India emerges as SL's top lender in 2022, gives $377 mn loan: Report
123.article_body: According to the Verite Research think-tank, India has emerged as the top lender to Sri Lanka in 2022 as the country faced unprecedented political crisis and economic turmoil. Of the total $968 million in loans which Sri Lanka received in 2022, India reportedly contributed $377 million to the nation. The Asian Development Bank follows India with $360 million in loans.

124.title: India's 1st lithium cell manufacturing plant to be launched in AP
124.article_body: Minister of State for IT Rajeev Chandrasekhar will launch the pre-production run of India's first lithium cell manufacturing facility in Andhra Pradesh's Tirupati tomorrow. It has been set up by Munoth Industries, PIB reported. The plant's inauguration will be a step in the direction of realising the PM's vision of making India the global hub of electronic manufacturing, Chandrasekhar said.

125.title: Prohibition a complete failure, have asked Nitish Kumar to review: Kishor
125.article_body: Poll strategist Prashant Kishor on Thursday claimed that Bihar's liquor prohibition is a complete failure and said he has asked CM Nitish Kumar to review it. "[Prohibition] existing only on paper because of rampant corruption," Kishor said. Prashant Kishor also confirmed that he met CM Nitish Kumar along with former MP Pavan Varma on Tuesday.

126.title: Centre, Assam govt sign tripartite peace deal with 8 tribal outfits
126.article_body: Centre and Assam government on Thursday signed a tripartite peace deal with eight tribal outfits in presence of Union Home Minister Amit Shah. "Around 1,100 people belonging to Adivasi outfits of Assam are surrendering arms...We want Assam and...northeast [to] be drug-free [and] terrorism-free," Shah said. Centre seeks to end all border disputes in the northeast by 2024, he added.

127.title: All judges are on the same page: CJI Lalit on reports about rift among judges
127.article_body: Refuting the reports about the rift among judges of the Supreme Court regarding the new listing system of cases on Thursday, Chief Justice of India (CJI) UU Lalit said that "all judges are on the same page". "We have taken a new way of listing. What has been reported is not the correct state of affairs," he said.

128.title: Congress to pass key resolution ahead of party Prez election
128.article_body: Congress leader Madhusudan Mistry on Thursday said delegates of Pradesh Congress Committees (PCC) will pass a resolution to authorise the party's next President to appoint state chiefs. Mistry said the procedure to elect the party's next President was "open" and nothing would be hidden. Mistry said over 9,000 PCC delegates were being issued QR code-attached identity cards for the polls.

129.title: Girls, aged 2 & 4, die after family gets 'baba' to treat snake bite in Raj
129.article_body: Two sisters, aged two and four, died in Rajasthan's Dausa after their family took them to a 'baba' (quack) instead of a hospital for getting their snake bites treated. The 'baba' hit the girls' heads with brooms and gave them ritualistic ashes for three hours. After the girls showed no signs of improvement, their family took them to a hospital.

130.title: Google slashes 7 R&D projects, asks employees to find new jobs internally by Jan: Report
130.article_body: Google has slashed seven out of 14 experimental projects at its in-house R&D division called Area 120, TechCrunch reported. This comes amid Google's move to control spending and focus on projects that build on its "deep investment" in AI, a spokesperson stated. Affected employees will reportedly need to find new jobs within Google by January 2023 or lose their jobs.

131.title: Will not step down unless asked by RJD: Bihar Agri Minister
131.article_body: Bihar Agriculture Minister Sudhakar Singh, who accused the state Agriculture Department of corruption, on Thursday said that CM Nitish Kumar could sack him but he'll not step down unless asked to do so by his party. The RJD leader stated, "The final decision about the fate of my ministerial berth will be taken by...[RJD leaders] Lalu Prasad Yadav and...Tejashwi Yadav."

132.title: AAP leaders protest after police stop visit to landfill in Delhi
132.article_body: A group of Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) leaders on Thursday alleged they were stopped from visiting the Okhla landfill, which is under Municipal Corporation of Delhi. Led by MLA Saurabh Bharadwaj, the group later protested and raised slogans against the BJP. AAP is taking up visits to garbage hills across the city to highlight "failures" of the BJP-controlled municipal body.

133.title: Mizoram CM Zoramthanga meets Defence Minister Rajnath Singh
133.article_body: Mizoram CM Zoramthanga met Defence Minister Rajnath Singh in Delhi on Thursday. "We had a good discussion on critical issues including Mizoram's strategic importance," Zoramthanga tweeted. In the meeting, Zoramthanga urged Rajnath Singh to provide a plot within the Cantonment board area in the national capital to the [Mizoram] state government, an official statement said.

134.title: Biden administration appointed 130 Indian-Americans: US official
134.article_body: The US administration, led by President Joe Biden, has so far appointed 130 Indian-Americans to key posts, said Raj Panjabi, a senior member of the White House National Security Council. "I'm proud to be part of an administration that is committed to diversity," he said. Panjabi made the comments during an 'Azadi Ka Amrit Mahotsava' event at the US Capitol.

135.title: Institutes have power to prescribe uniforms, hijab issue is different: SC
135.article_body: Supreme Court on Thursday said that educational institutes have the power to prescribe uniforms, however, it also noted that the hijab issue is different. A bench comprising Justices Hemant Gupta and Sudhanshu Dhulia has been hearing a batch of petitions challenging the ban on wearing hijab in institutes. The next hearing on the matter will be held on September 19.

136.title: Strict action should be taken: MP CM on rape of nursery student
136.article_body: Calling the sexual assault of a nursery student on the school bus a "faith-shaking" incident, Madhya Pradesh Chief Minister Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Thursday called a meeting to give necessary directions on the matter. "Strict action should be taken against the guilty driver, female help, as well as the school management," CM Chouhan said in a tweet.

137.title: Daler Mehndi's sentence in human trafficking case suspended
137.article_body: The Punjab and Haryana High Court suspended Punjabi singer Daler Mehndi's two-year jail term after his conviction in a 2003 human trafficking case. Mehndi's lawyer Arshdeep Singh Cheema said, "His sentence has been suspended, which means that he will be out on bail, pending proceedings before the high court." Earlier, he was convicted by a trial court in 2018.

138.title: Ramdev to announce IPO plans of Patanjali Group tomorrow: Report
138.article_body: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev will reportedly announce the IPO plans of five Patanjali Group companies on Friday during a press conference. The companies are expected to be listed on the stock market within the next five years. Other than IPO plans, he'll also unveil five major policies and goals for the next five years towards achieving "Atmanirbhar Bharat (self-reliant India)".

139.title: Adobe to acquire online design startup Figma for $20 billion
139.article_body: Adobe has announced that it'll acquire online design startup Figma for $20 billion in cash and stock. Figma, founded in 2012, creates cloud-based design software that allows teams to collaborate in real time. "Approximately 6 million additional restricted stock units will be granted to Figma's CEO and employees that will vest over four years subsequent to closing," Adobe said.

140.title: India blessed to have talented pool of engineers: PM on Engineer's Day
140.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Thursday conveyed greetings to all engineers of the country on the occasion of Engineer's Day, stating that India is blessed to have a skilled and talented pool of engineers who contribute to nation-building. "Our government is working to enhance [the] infrastructure for studying engineering including building more engineering colleges," he said in a tweet.

141.title: He doesn't have in-depth knowledge: CM Khandu on Rahul Gandhi's China tweet
141.article_body: A day after Congress leader Rahul Gandhi alleged Prime Minister Narendra Modi gave 1000 sq km of territory to China without a fight, Arunachal Pradesh Chief Minister Pema Khandu on Thursday said he doesn't have in-depth knowledge. "Rahul Gandhi doesn't have much knowledge of the northeast, let alone Arunachal. He raises...issues...on which he doesn't have in-depth knowledge," Khandu said.

142.title: Stray dog killed, hanged on door in Kerala after multiple dog bite cases
142.article_body: A stray dog was killed and then publicly hanged in Kerala's Changanassery on Tuesday after the state reported multiple cases of dog bites in the past few days. A wreath was also placed close to the animal's carcass. The carcasses of 10 stray dogs were also discovered on Monday in the state's Kottayam district. Locals had reportedly poisoned the dogs.

143.title: Huge fireball spotted across the sky over Scotland, pics go viral
143.article_body: A giant 'fireball' was spotted on the night of September 14 across Scotland, clips of which were shared on social media. "There's a great deal of speculation...The evidence we have seen so far indicates space junk," tweeted UK Meteor Network. It is likely to have been space junk from Elon Musk's satellite programme, according to astronomers examining it.

144.title: How much prize money has Roger Federer won in his career?
144.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer, who will retire after the Laver Cup next week, has won 103 singles titles in his career. He has won 1,251 out of the 1,526 singles matches he has played so far. The 41-year-old has won a total prize money of $130,594,339 in his career. Federer had turned pro in 1998.

145.title: Google cancels 7 R&D projects, asks employees to find jobs by Jan 2023: Report
145.article_body: Google has cancelled seven out of 14 projects at its in-house research and development (R&D) division, Area 120. Google reportedly told affected employees that they'll need to find a new job within Google by end-January 2023 or they'll be terminated. "We've recently shared that Area 120 will be shifting its focus to projects that build on...AI," a Google spokesperson said.

146.title: TMC stages protest mocking Suvendu's 'Don't touch me, I'm male' remark
146.article_body: TMC on Thursday staged a protest in Kolkata against BJP's 'Nabanna Cholo' rally and carried placards mocking BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari's "Don't touch [me]..." remark. 'Modi Ji: Entire India is on sale. Nirmala Tai: All our ideas are going to fail. Suvendu: Don't touch my body, I am male', placards read. Adhikari made the comment while being detained on Tuesday.

147.title: Rahul won't gain politically from 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': Athawale
147.article_body: Union Minister Ramdas Athawale on Thursday said Rahul Gandhi will not gain politically from 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' as long as PM Modi is the Prime Minister. "The Constitution drafted by Dr BR Ambedkar has united different religions, castes and languages," Athawale said. "PM Narendra Modi is taking this forward with his 'Sabka Saath, Sabka Vikas, Sabka Vishwas' vision," he added.

148.title: ‘If a rape happens, is it CM who is doing it?’: Bihar Dy CM Tejashwi
148.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav on Thursday criticised BJP leader Giriraj Singh and asked if the CM is involved in a crime like rape, if such an incident takes place in BJP-led states. His remarks came after Singh blamed Bihar CM Nitish Kumar for the Begusarai firing incident. "On what basis does the BJP question our law-and-order situation?" Tejashwi asked.

149.title: 57-yr-old woman falls off roof while escaping monkey attack in UP, dies
149.article_body: A 57-year-old woman, Munni, was killed after falling off a roof while escaping from a monkey attack in Uttar Pradesh's Etawah, police sources said on Thursday. The woman had gone to the roof of her house to dry clothes when she was attacked by monkeys, they said. The woman was taken to a hospital where she succumbed to her injuries.

150.title: 2 female IT professionals killed in Chennai after being hit by car running at 130 kmph
150.article_body: Two female software professionals were killed after getting hit by a speeding Honda City when they were crossing the road in Chennai's IT corridor on Wednesday night. S Lavanya and R Lakshmi, both 23, worked at HCL State Street Service. The car appeared to have run at a speed of around 130 kmph and the 20-year-old driver has surrendered.

151.title: TRS, BJP not in position to face people due to failed promises: Cong MP
151.article_body: Telangana Congress MP Uttam Kumar Reddy claimed TRS or BJP weren't in a position to face people due to the long list of failed promises. "Whenever any TRS or BJP leader enters your area, ask...about their failure to control rising prices of petrol, diesel and other...commodities," Reddy said. He claimed that Congress would retain the Munugode seat in the bypolls.

152.title: 5 kg gold seized from passenger at Kerala's Kozhikode airport, held
152.article_body: The Customs at Kerala's Calicut International Airport in Kozhikode on Thursday said they seized around 5 kg of gold worth ₹2.5 crore from a passenger who arrived from Dubai. The officials said the accused smuggled gold mixed with other metals, in connivance with two officials of a private airline. The accused and the two airline employees have been arrested.

153.title: Ukraine returned students cannot join Indian varsities: Govt to SC
153.article_body: The Centre told the Supreme Court that the students who returned from Ukraine cannot be accommodated in Indian universities as there was no provision for it in the National Medical Commission Act. The Centre said that allowing this would hamper the standards of medical education in India. Justices Hemant Gupta and Sudhanshu Dhulia will likely hear the case on Friday.

154.title: No stigma attached to word 'anaath' (orphan): Bombay HC
154.article_body: While discussing a public interest litigation (PIL), the Bombay High Court said that there is no stigma attached to the word 'anaath' or orphan and there was no need to change it. The PIL, filed by an NGO, sought that the word 'anaath' be changed to 'swanath'. The court said it was not a case for them to intervene.

155.title: 2 ICU patients die due to power cut in Karnataka hospital
155.article_body: Two patients in the ICU of Vijayanagara Institute of Medical Sciences (VIMS) hospital in Karnataka's Ballari reportedly died due to ventilator failure after a power cut in the hospital. The two patients have been identified as Maula Hussein (35), suffering from kidney-related ailments, and Chettemma (30), a snake-bite victim. VIMS, however, said the deaths were not due to power cuts.

156.title: Malware in 28 games like FIFA & PUBG exploit 3.8 lakh users: Report
156.article_body: FIFA and PUBG are among 28 games that were exploited by malware between July 2021-June 2022, affecting over 3.84 lakh users using nearly 92,000 malicious files, a report by Kaspersky researchers said. Attackers create fraudulent pages mimicking in-game stores' interface to cheat users into entering their social media login credentials. The pages offer users in-game weapons and artefacts for free.

157.title: Will wear slippers only after killers are hanged: Kanhaiya Lal's son
157.article_body: Months after Udaipur-based tailor Kanhaiya Lal was beheaded, his son said that he has sworn to wear slippers only after his father's killers are hanged. Yash Sahoo, who remains barefoot even at his workplace, has demanded the arrest of "terrorists Riyaz and Gaus Mohammad". Lal was killed for supporting suspended BJP leader Nupur Sharma over her remarks against Prophet Muhammad.

158.title: Roger Federer announces his retirement from tennis
158.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer on Thursday announced his retirement from professional tennis aged 41. He stated the Laver Cup that will take place in London next week will be his last ATP event. "This is a bittersweet decision...because I'll miss everything the tour has given me," Federer said. Federer last played a competitive match at Wimbledon last year.

159.title: Govt to introduce subsidy to set up EV charging infrastructure: Power Secy
159.article_body: Power Secretary Alok Kumar has said the government is working to introduce a subsidy for companies that'll set up electric vehicle charging hubs across India. He said a subsidy of around ₹4-5 lakh will be provided to set up a 200-KW charging infrastructure for EVs. He added the government is working to amend the FAME II policy for the same.

160.title: TMC govt 'fascist', 'dictatorial': BJP amid West Bengal rally violence
160.article_body: The BJP on Thursday criticised the West Bengal government over violence during its protest in Kolkata, saying that TMC is working with a "fascist" and "dictatorial" mindset. WB CM Mamata Banerjee on Wednesday alleged that BJP had brought in goons for the rally and said the police could have opened fire on BJP protesters, but her government exercised restraint.

161.title: Stop embarrassing India: BJP spokesman to AAP amid BMW row
161.article_body: After German car brand BMW refuted Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann's claim that it's planning to set up a manufacturing unit in Punjab, BJP spokesperson Shehzad Poonawalla tweeted, "Kattar Liars! AAP - AUR ADHIK PROPAGANDA." He added, "Mann [and Arvind] Kejriwal…BMW manufacturing unit aapke bas ki nahi hai (it's beyond your capacity) #StopEmbarrasingIndia." Mann and Kejriwal are Aam Aadmi Party leaders.

162.title: Byju's left with 8 days to pay Blackstone ₹2,000 cr for Aakash deal
162.article_body: Edtech unicorn Byju's has eight days left to clear the remaining balance of nearly ₹2,000 crore to Blackstone as part of its Aakash acquisition deal, according to its financial report. Byju's has deferred the payment multiple times over the last few months. It will have to seek extension from the RBI if it doesn't complete the payment by September 23.

163.title: Burglar who stole only on Sundays arrested in Chennai after 2 years
163.article_body: A burglar who stole only on Sundays for the past two years because he worked in an office near Chennai on other days has been arrested, police said. The accused, M Sivachandiran, was caught near Poonamallee by authorities earlier this week after they surveilled CCTV footage. At least 10 sovereigns of gold jewellery were recovered from him, police said.

164.title: Belgian tourist looted by auto driver, 2 others during Taj Mahal tour
164.article_body: An auto driver, along with two of his aides, reportedly looted a 25-year-old Belgian tourist in Agra. According to police, the accused looted 8,000 Euros in cash, one laptop, one camera, a mobile phone and a pair of shoes from the tourist who came to see the Taj Mahal. The tourist, Sevi, a native of Goa, is working in Belgium.

165.title: UP man complains about potholes as rickshaw overturns behind him, video surfaces
165.article_body: An e-rickshaw full of passengers recently overturned in a potholed-filled stretch of UP's Ballia, as a local was describing to a reporter the plight of residents because of the poor condition of roads. He said that e-rickshaws struggle to cross the area on a regular basis, adding that commuters have suffered injuries because of potholes.

166.title: Accused in UP rape-murder of Dalit sisters shot in leg during encounter, video surfaces
166.article_body: One of the accused in the rape-murder of two teenage sisters in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri was arrested on Thursday after an encounter, in which police shot him in his leg. A video shows police bringing the injured man out of a field. A total of six men were arrested after bodies of the sisters were found hanging from a tree.

167.title: 3 empty gun cartridges found at RSS shakha venue in Ludhiana
167.article_body: An FIR has been registered after three empty cartridges of a 32 bore weapon were found on Wednesday from Shaheedi Park in Ludhiana, an RSS shakha venue, police said. Some miscreants indulged in hooliganism on Tuesday night and one of them may have opened fire, according to police. The cartridges were recovered by RSS volunteers who were cleaning the premises.

168.title: 2 women tell Thane man his house has evil spirits; cheat him of ₹15 lakh
168.article_body: A 79-year-old man in Thane was cheated of ₹15.87 lakh after he was told by two women that evil spirits had invaded his house. The women made the senior citizen, who was living alone, give them the money between July and September by suggesting certain rituals, police said. The man approached the police and a case was registered on Tuesday.

169.title: GST collection may cross ₹1.5 lakh crore from Oct: Revenue Secy
169.article_body: The Goods and Services Tax (GST) collection may top the ₹1.5-lakh-crore-mark from October, Revenue Secretary Tarun Bajaj said on Wednesday. "The revenue that we'll collect in October...I'm sure from that month onwards the CBIC on a regular basis shall deliver ₹1.5 trillion revenue for the government," Bajaj said. The government collected ₹1.43 lakh crore in revenue from GST in August.

170.title: 6 roads worth ₹1.12 crore to be laid in Hyderabad
170.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) Mayor Vijayalaxmi Gadwal inaugurated the project to lay six roads worth ₹1.12 crore in Hyderabad's Khairatabad. Speaking at the inauguration, the Mayor said that quality of the works being executed must be maintained. Additionally, the GHMC will also install 94 Pelican signals at key locations with push-button option for pedestrians to cross safely.

171.title: Gurugram resident arrested after man loses ₹1.4 lakh to crypto scam
171.article_body: A hearing and speech impaired man was arrested in Gurugram on Wednesday for cheating people in a cryptocurrency scam. Sanjeev Singh used to divert the cheated money to a US-based woman named Diana, police said. The arrest was made following the complaint of a man who allegedly lost ₹1.4 lakh after Diana lured him to invest in cryptocurrency.

172.title: MP serial killer who murdered 4 guards kept in isolation as inmates fear him
172.article_body: An 18-year-old serial killer, who has been accused of killing 4 security guards, has been kept in isolation in MP's Sagar central jail as other inmates fear him, an official said on Thursday. When he takes a bath, jail wardens remain nearby and his plate is taken back immediately after he finishes eating, said Jail Superintendent Rakesh Bhangre.

173.title: Fire breaks out in Cooper hospital's godown in Mumbai
173.article_body: A fire reportedly broke out in the godown of Mumbai's Dr R N Cooper Hospital on Thursday evening. As reported by ANI, the fire department confirmed no casualties were reported in the incident. The fire was brought under control, the fire department added.
