Cooper hospital is a government hospital located in Juhu.

174.title: Goa to organise 'Clean Coast, Safe Sea' program on Sept 17
174.article_body: The Goa government will organise a beach cleanliness drive on September 17, officials said on Thursday. The program titled 'Clean Coast, Safe Sea' will start at 8 am on International Coastal Cleanup Day. "Goa, being a tourist state famous for Sun, Sand and Sea, it's important to keep the beaches clean and safe for the tourists," CM Sawant tweeted.

175.title: Nurses at BMC-run Kasturba Hospital protest, demand 8 weekly-offs a month
175.article_body: Nurses at BMC-run Kasturba Gandhi Hospital in Mumbai held a protest on Thursday, demanding eight weekly-offs every month. "There's too much workload where nurses work round the clock," Pradeep Govind Narkar, Assistant General Secretary of Municipal Labour Union, said. This comes days after hospitals like Lokmanya Tilak Municipal General Hospital and KEM Hospital saw protests with similar demands.

176.title: 2 women pull hair, slap each other during fight at toll plaza in Maharashtra, video viral
176.article_body: A video has gone viral showing two women pulling each other's hair and slapping each other after a fight broke between them at a toll plaza in Maharashtra. One of the women was an employee at the toll plaza. In the video, other employees can be seen trying to stop the fight. The exact reason behind the fight isn't known.

177.title: KCR to inaugurate Adivasi Bhavan, Banjara bhavan in Hyd on Sept 17
177.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao will inaugurate Komaram Bheem Adivasi Bhavan and Sevalal Banjara building on September 17 in Hyderabad. The Sevalal Banjara building and Adivasi Bhavan were built at the cost of ₹24.43 crore and ₹24.68 crore respectively. Officials said the state government is implementing numerous welfare and development schemes to ensure comprehensive development of tribals.

178.title: 8 held for using Bluetooth earbuds to ‘cheat’ in railway exam in Noida
178.article_body: Police have arrested eight men for allegedly cheating in a railway recruitment examination using electronic devices, including wireless Bluetooth earphones, in Noida. The accused were arrested from an examination facility in Noida's Sector 62 during RRC Level-1 examination held on Tuesday. Police are "tracing call detail records to identify the person who was feeding the answers to the accused".

179.title: Pakistan's squad for T20 World Cup 2022 announced
179.article_body: Pakistan on Thursday announced their 15-man squad for the T20 World Cup 2022. Fast bowler Shaheen Afridi, who is currently recovering from an injury, has been included in the squad. The squad also features Shan Masood, who's yet to feature in a T20I, while Haider Ali was recalled to the side after last featuring in December 2021.

180.title: Road in Ahmedabad caves in, civic body's truck falls into the crack
180.article_body: A road in Ahmedabad's Juhapura caved in on Wednesday afternoon and led to Ahmedabad Municipal Corporation's (AMC) garbage truck falling into the crack. The area was barricaded after the truck was pulled out using a crane. This was the 92nd cave-in to have been reported in Ahmedabad after July 10. Of the 92 cave-ins, AMC claims to have repaired 84.

181.title: K'taka signed MoUs worth ₹1.3 lakh crore in renewable energy: CM
181.article_body: Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said on Thursday his state has inked memoranda of understanding worth ₹1.3 lakh crore in the renewable energy sector. "We are doing extensive work in...renewable energy. We will soon start producing hydrogen fuel," he said. The state wants to install renewable energy projects near the coast and industries along the Mumbai-Chennai corridor, he said.

182.title: Hindu Sena demands renaming of Delhi's Babar Road to Bhagwan Valmiki Marg
182.article_body: The Hindu Sena on Wednesday wrote to New Delhi Municipal Council (NDMC) demanding the renaming of Babar Road in the Bengali market to Bhagwan Valmiki Marg. The organisation said the road's name reminds people of atrocities done by Mughal ruler Babar on Hindus. "Everyone knows that Babar was an invader, an infiltrator, a jihadi terrorist," the Hindu Sena's letter stated.

183.title: Haryana CM pays ₹2,500 to woman whose pension stopped midway
183.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar has given ₹2,500 from his own pocket to an elderly woman who complained that her pension was stopped after records allegedly showed her as dead, officials said. Khattar directed officials to restore the pension of all eligible beneficiaries whose pension was stopped due to improper data verification. He was addressing Jan Samvad grievance redressal programme.

184.title: ₹110-crore misappropriated in Bengaluru bank: State Co-op Minister
184.article_body: An audit of Bengaluru-based Shushruti Souharda Sahakara Bank Niyamita has revealed ₹110 crore misappropriation from its deposits, State Minister of Co-Operation ST Somashekar said at the Legislative Council. “However, in its reply, the department said that the bank cannot be listed as bankrupt,” Somashekar said. At the time of audit, the bank had recorded ₹180.77 crore in received deposits.

185.title: Odisha woman shot dead while trying to save husband from giving 'hafta'
185.article_body: A 45-year-old woman in Odisha's Nuapada was allegedly shot dead on Wednesday night while trying to save her husband from an armed youth asking for 'hafta' (extortion money). The inebriated youth threatened to kill the man if he failed to pay ₹10,000 as 'hafta'. A fire tender took the woman to the hospital as no ambulances were available.

186.title: BJP 'gifts' 5 autos to Kejriwal after Guj police stop him from riding in an auto
186.article_body: Delhi BJP MLAs on Thursday reached CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence to "gift" him five autorickshaws, days after he had an argument with Gujarat Police after they tried to stop him from travelling in an auto. Kejriwal has a convoy of 27 vehicles and 200 security personnel, but he enacted drama by travelling in an auto, said BJP's Ramvir Singh Bidhuri.

187.title: Mental strength as important as physical fitness in MMA: Ritu Phogat
187.article_body: Ahead of her fight at One Championship's Singapore event later this month, wrestler-turned-Mixed Martial Arts (MMA) fighter Ritu Phogat has said that being mentally strong is more important than being physically strong during matches. Talking about her last fight, which she lost, Ritu said, "The loss didn't affect me mentally...Winning and losing is a part and parcel of the game."

188.title: 38-year-old history-sheeter stabbed to death in Hyderabad
188.article_body: A group of people stabbed a 38-year-old history-sheeter to death in Hyderabad's Bahadurpura. The victim, identified as Babu Khan, was going on the road when he was stopped and attacked by a group of people with sharp weapons. Suspecting "old enmity", the police said that the victim's rivals might be involved in his murder.

189.title: B'luru municipality using 1984 map for its anti-encroachment drive
189.article_body: The Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) is using a map from 1984 to carry out its anti-encroachment drive, after heavy rains last week exposed the deficiencies in the city's drainage system. So far, the BBMP has demolished encroachments in Shantiniketan Layout, Munnekolalu and Challaghatta. BBMP Chief Commissioner Tushar Giri Nath has said all identified encroachments will be taken down.

190.title: Richa-Ali to host pre-wedding events in Delhi Gymkhana Club: Report
190.article_body: Richa Chadha and Ali Fazal will reportedly host their pre-wedding festivities in Delhi Gymkhana Club. As per reports, their pre-wedding functions will start from September 30. The actors are said to be wrapping up their respective projects by the end of next week. While Richa is working on Sanjay Leela Bhansali's 'Heeramandi', Ali will be seen in 'Mirzapur 3'.

191.title: Nadal's Aus Open final match gave me extra motivation: Iga Swiatek
191.article_body: World number one Iga Swiatek, who won the French Open and the US Open this season, has said Rafael Nadal's win at the 2022 Australian Open final against Daniil Medvedev gave her "extra motivation" and "inspired" her. In the match, Nadal was two sets down before he came back and defeated Medvedev to win his 21st Grand Slam singles title.

192.title: Harshest action to be taken against criminals: UP Dy CM on Lakhimpur incident
192.article_body: Following the Lakhimpur Kheri incident, where two minor Dalit sisters were allegedly raped and murdered, UP Deputy CM Keshav Prasad Maurya said this incident is sad and unfortunate. "Harshest action to be taken against all criminals. I'd expect the Opposition, whether Akhilesh Yadav, Priyanka Gandhi or Mayawati, that instead of politicising...console the family," Maurya added.

193.title: Connaught Place, Saket to soon get microbreweries, excise dept gives nod
193.article_body: Delhi's Connaught Place and Saket will soon get microbreweries serving draught beer after the excise department issued their licenses. According to officials, 10 microbreweries will be opened in Saket under the L-11 licence while CP will also get new microbreweries. Delhi people will get fresh beers from the first week of October, officials said.

194.title: PM should apologise for doing a fake sting if I'm not arrested by Mon: Sisodia
194.article_body: After BJP released a new sting video in connection with the Delhi liquor scam, AAP leader and Delhi Deputy CM Manish Sisodia challenged the CBI to arrest him by Monday. "If the allegations are correct, they should arrest me by Monday. If not, the PM should apologise to me for this fake sting by Monday," Sisodia said in a tweet.

195.title: Very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states, list released
195.article_body: The IMD, in its latest bulletin, issued very heavy rainfall warning for several states. Very heavy rainfall is likely over Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh till September 17. Very heavy rainfall is also very likely over Goa and Maharashtra till tomorrow. Further, heavy rainfall is expected over Odisha on September 18 and 19.

196.title: Samsung to invest over $5 bn with aim of net zero emissions by 2050
196.article_body: Samsung Electronics will invest over $5.02 billion (7 trillion won) by 2030 towards environmental initiatives with an aim to make the company carbon neutral by 2050. It also plans to bolster the recycling of resources such as lithium and plastic. The chip and mobile maker said it joined a group of global corporations committed to 100% renewable energy called RE100.

197.title: Edtech firm upGrad acquires Centum Learning in share-swap deal
197.article_body: Edtech unicorn upGrad has acquired New Delhi-based corporate training solutions startup Centum Learning in a share-swap deal. After the transaction is completed, Bharti Enterprises, which owns Centum Learning, and its affiliates will join upGrad's cap table. Centum will continue to operate independently under Managing Director and CEO, Sanjay Bahl, the company said in a statement.

198.title: Billionaire Venture signs MoU with DBS Bank to fund startups
198.article_body: Billionaire Venture Incubation has signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) with DBS Bank to facilitate equity investments in startups. The joint venture will earmark about $200 million to invest in over 150 startups across Tamil Nadu, Maharashtra and Karnataka, initially. The joint venture will be focusing on 16 verticals and will immediately focus on fintech and edtech, among others.

199.title: Tata-owned Air India aims 30% domestic market share in 5 years
199.article_body: In a bid to have a domestic market share of 30% and strengthen its international operations, Air India has put in place a transformation plan. The Tata-owned airline announced 'Vihaan.AI' with a detailed roadmap for the next five years with focus on growing its network and fleet. The airline is expected to soon induct 30 new wide-body and narrow-body aircraft.

200.title: Guj man mistakenly gets ₹11,677 cr in demat account, invests ₹2 cr in stocks
200.article_body: A bank glitch caused a man in Ahmedabad to receive ₹11,677 crore in his demat account for a few hours. The man said that out of this amount, he invested ₹2 crore in the stock market and booked a profit of ₹5 lakh but that same evening, Kotak Securities withdrew the amount. Kotak Securities is yet to comment on this.

201.title: Some people trying to give it different colour: Tejashwi on Begusarai firing
201.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav while commenting on the Begusarai shooting incident said some people are trying to give it a different colour. "BJP…never does as it says, all they do is divide people and poison society," Yadav added. One person was killed and 11 others were injured in firing by bike-borne men at multiple locations in Begusarai on Tuesday.

202.title: Ready to cooperate: K'taka Congress chief Shivakumar on ED summons
202.article_body: Karnataka Congress chief DK Shivakumar was on Thursday summoned by the Enforcement Directorate (ED) in connection with a money laundering case. "I'm ready to cooperate but the timing of this summon and the harassment I'm put through, is coming in the way of discharging my constitutional and political duties," Shivakumar tweeted. Notably, the summons come amid Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra'.

203.title: Assam govt asked to pay ₹25,000 to boy assaulted in police station
203.article_body: The National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) has ordered the Assam government to pay ₹25,000 to a 13-year-old boy who was beaten using a stick by an Assistant Sub-Inspector inside a police station. The incident happened in Morigaon district about six months ago. The rights body also asked the government to initiate prosecution proceedings against the suspended police officer.

204.title: PVR Limited shares fall 4.4% after reports of a block deal
204.article_body: PVR Limited shares dropped 4.4% to close at ₹1,844.5 on BSE on Thursday after reports of a block deal in which around 4.7 million shares or 7.7% stake changed hands. The shares were reportedly traded at an average price of ₹1,892 apiece. Details of buyers and sellers are not known yet. The stock opened 2.3% lower at ₹1,882 a share.

205.title: Vedanta-Foxconn project going to Guj is attack on Maha's prestige: Shiv Sena
205.article_body: The Shiv Sena said that the semiconductor project of Vedanta-Foxconn going to Gujarat is an attack on Maharashtra's prestige. When BJP's Devendra Fadnavis was CM from 2014-19, the GIFT City project was handed over to Gujarat and current CM Eknath Shinde similarly allowed the semiconductor plant to slip away, Shiv Sena said in its mouthpiece 'Saamana'.

206.title: India's Russian oil imports rose to 18% of total crude bought in July
206.article_body: With Russian petroleum crude imports worth $2.88 billion in July, India's oil imports from Russia surged to nearly 18% of its total petroleum crude imports, Commerce Ministry data showed. In June, oil imported from Russia was 16.8% of total petroleum crude imports. Imports of crude oil, products and petroleum surged to $17.7 billion in August, provisional data for trade showed.

207.title: Why was Nora Fatehi summoned by Delhi Police in ₹200-crore money laundering case?
207.article_body: Actress Nora Fatehi, who appeared before Delhi Police in a ₹200-crore money laundering case on Thursday, was questioned over her links to conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar and actress Jacqueline Fernandez, officials said. "Both the actresses were introduced to Sukesh by one Pinky Irani. She will be questioned alongside Irani," said an officer. Police clarified that Nora Fatehi is not an accused.

208.title: BPCL divestment plan not on the table as of now: Union Minister Puri
208.article_body: The divestment plan for Bharat Petroleum Corporation Limited is not on the table as of now as it can't find an adequate number of bidders for the process, Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri said. The Centre had in August said that it would decide on re-initiating BPCL's strategic sale process based on a review of the situation in due course.

209.title: Pune Zilla Parishad begins leprosy, TB eradication drive
209.article_body: The health department of Pune Zilla Parishad has started a leprosy and tuberculosis eradication drive. During the drive, ASHA workers, male volunteers and health workers will carry out doorstep checks for symptoms and spread awareness. Launched under the National Leprosy Eradication Programme (NLEP), the programme will cover over 5 lakh people in rural and urban areas of the district.

210.title: Culprits should be hanged: Father of Lakhimpur rape, murder victims
210.article_body: The father of the two Dalit sisters who were allegedly raped and murdered in Uttar Pradesh's  Lakhimpur Kheri has stated that the culprits should be hanged. "My daughters were abducted from the house and...were raped and murdered. I demand justice," he added. After the sisters were found hanging from a tree, villagers carried out a march and blocked a road.

211.title: Sudanese woman held at Hyderabad airport, gold worth ₹14 lakh seized
211.article_body: Customs officials at Hyderabad's Rajiv Gandhi International Airport apprehended a female Sudanese national who was smuggling gold and seized 272.98 grams of gold worth ₹14.15 lakh. The woman passenger arrived from Dubai by flight EK 524 and was trying to smuggle gold in the form of paste by concealing it in her rectum, Hyderabad Customs tweeted.

212.title: CBI searches 6 locations in Delhi, Kolkata in WB SSC scam case
212.article_body: CBI on Thursday conducted searches at six locations in Delhi and Kolkata in connection with the West Bengal School Service Commission (SSC) scam, officials said. The searches were conducted at the premises of a software company. Records were allegedly manipulated in the appointment of teachers following which the role of the company came into the limelight.

213.title: Kohli should be opening in T20 WC, it just gives the right balance: Parthiv
213.article_body: Ex-India wicketkeeper-batter Parthiv Patel has said Virat Kohli should open in the upcoming T20 World Cup. "It's very clear. [It] was clear that Virat should be opening in Asia Cup...It just gives the right balance," he stated. "If Rohit and Kohli can play till the first six overs...more often than not they will get India to around fifty," added Parthiv.

214.title: 22-yr-old biker crushed by dumper making an illegal U-turn in Mumbai
214.article_body: A 22-year-old biker from Mumbai, Prafful Sanjay Bhosale, was run over by a dumper supplying material for the Coastal Road project on Tuesday. Police said that the overloaded dumper made an illegal U-turn on Khan Abdul Gaffar Khan road at Worli. "Due to the sudden U-turn, Bhosale directly came under the front wheel of the dumper," a police official said.

215.title: Pak collected $40 million to build a 'mega dam' & spent $63 million on its ads
215.article_body: Touted to be Pakistan's "mega dam" that would prevent flooding issues, it has been revealed that $40 million was raised from the public for Diamer-Bhasha Dam's construction and $63 million was spent on its advertising while the construction remains unfinished. The army gave up a portion of soldiers' salaries to contribute to this project and the cricket team also participated.

216.title: Will feed you in morning and noon, you just study: Stalin tells students
216.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin launched first phase of a state-wide free breakfast programme for students in classes one to five. "We see it as a government duty rather than a cost to the exchequer," he said. "We will feed you in the morning and at noon...You may please study, study, study without any worries," Stalin told students.

217.title: Might even trade Mumbai: Sena on CM Shinde amid ₹1,54,000 cr deal row
217.article_body: The Shiv Sena on Thursday said the mega semiconductor project of Vedanta-Foxconn worth  ₹1,54,000 crore going to Gujarat was an attack on Maharashtra's "prestige". One day, the Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government "might even trade Mumbai", said the editorial in the Shiv Sena mouthpiece 'Saamana'.

218.title: Dalit man beaten for drinking water from pot for upper castes in Raj
218.article_body: A Dalit man was allegedly beaten by a group of men for drinking water from a pot meant for upper-caste people kept outside a grocery shop in Rajasthan's Jaisalmer on Tuesday. The victim, who was accompanied by his wife, was struck with iron rods and sticks, said police. Four people have been booked under the SC/ST Act.

219.title: PMC floats tender for construction of 350-bed hospital in Warje
219.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has floated a tender for the construction and management of a 350-bed hospital in Warje on a public-private partnership model. According to officials, the multi-speciality hospital would be constructed at an estimated cost of ₹350 crore. It will have medical technology of international standards and will promote medical tourism as well, officials said.

220.title: 35-yr-old relative killed 8-month pregnant woman in Hyd for revenge: Police
220.article_body: A week after a 32-year-old pregnant woman was allegedly murdered at her home in Hyderabad's Kondapur, police have arrested her relative, a 35-year-old man from Andhra Pradesh. The accused had a grudge against the victim's family for reportedly instigating his wife to complain of domestic violence and dowry harassment to the police a month ago, police said.

221.title: Tiger kills man in MP's Balaghat, villagers told to stay indoors
221.article_body: A 22-year-old man was mauled to death by a tiger in Madhya Pradesh's Balaghat district on Tuesday. The incident occurred when Phool Singh Madavi had gone to graze his livestock in the forest along with four other villagers. Following the incident, forest department officials requested the people of Pandrapani village to stay indoors and avoid venturing into the forest.

222.title: Ayan, Ranbir visit Somnath Temple days after 'Brahmastra' release
222.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor, along with Ayan Mukerji, sought blessings at Somnath Temple on Thursday. Sharing a picture on Instagram, Ayan wrote, "I'd told myself I would come here after 'Brahmastra' releases, and am so happy and energised that we made it here." Earlier, Ranbir was stopped from visiting Ujjain's Mahakaleshwar Temple by Bajrang Dal workers over his remarks on consuming beef.

223.title: No decision yet: Samsung as reports claim it's returning to Russia
223.article_body: Samsung on Thursday said nothing has been decided after media reports claimed that the company was returning to the Russian market, six months after suspending shipments over invasion of Ukraine. Reports had claimed that Samsung could restart sales in Russia in October. It was also reported that Samsung would resume supplies of equipment to retailers and restart its online store.

224.title: Bengaluru Police nab interstate gang that targets lone travellers
224.article_body: The City Crime Branch (CCB) of Bengaluru Police have caught an inter-state gang that allegedly robbed people of money and valuables at knife-point. The main targets of the gang were lone travellers between states, the police said. Valuables worth ₹50 lakh including 619 mobile phones, two cars, one two-wheeler and one laptop have been seized, the police added.

225.title: BEST warns consumers against fake messages after several trapped
225.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) has warned its consumers not to respond to any fraudulent messages regarding bill payments purportedly on behalf of the undertaking. The authorities directed residents to avoid any message other than from 'BESTSM'. The warning comes after many customers complained that they received fraudulent SMS and many got cheated as well.

226.title: Drunk driver rams car into 66-year-old man in Mumbai's Vasai
226.article_body: A 36-year-old man, who was reportedly driving drunk, rammed into a 66-year-old man on a scooter in Mumbai's Vasai on Tuesday. According to police, the man was flung 10 feet in air and sustained severe injuries to his leg and hand after crashing on road. The accused, who fled the spot, was driving back from an alcohol party, police said.

227.title: Maharashtra CM calls PM Modi over Vedanta-Foxconn facility, says PM promised big projects
227.article_body: Following Vedanta-Foxconn's decision to set up a semiconductor facility in Gujarat, Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde called PM Narendra Modi. "I've requested PM Modi that there is a need to give a boost to industries here since there is scope, infrastructure and potential," he said. PM promised that the Centre would help bring "big projects" to Maharashtra, Shinde added.

228.title: Afghanistan announce squad for T20 World Cup 2022, include 10 players aged 23 or under
228.article_body: Afghanistan on Thursday announced their 15-member squad for T20 World Cup 2022. Mohammad Nabi will lead the team, while Najibullah Zadran has been named his deputy. The squad includes as many as 10 players who are aged 23 or under. Salim Safi, a 20-year-old fast bowler, has received his maiden international call-up.

229.title: Special plane to bring 8 cheetahs to India from Namibia, pic released
229.article_body: The High Commission of India in Windhoek, Namibia shared the picture of the special plane that will bring eight cheetahs to India from Namibia. "A special bird touches down in the Land of the Brave to carry goodwill ambassadors to the Land of the Tiger," the caption read. The huge plane has face of a tiger painted on its front.

230.title: I told Babar 'If you don't think I'm needed anymore, tell me': Shoaib Malik
230.article_body: Amid debate over Pakistan's middle-order and omission of Shoaib Malik from their Asia Cup squad, an old video of the all-rounder's interview has gone viral. In the interview, Shoaib revealed that Babar had asked him if he wanted to retire. "[I said], 'If you want me to play...I'll'...Babar said, 'I'll let you know which series you'll play'," said Malik.

231.title: Govt panel calls for new regulatory body for classifying online games: Report
231.article_body: A panel of central government officials said in its report that India should create a regulatory body to classify online games as skill or chance-based and to introduce rules to block prohibited formats, Reuters reported. The report further states that India also needs a new law to provide regulatory flexibility to the government. Union IT Ministry will finalise the report.

232.title: G Khan booked for singing 'Peg Mote', 'Choli Ke Peeche' at Ganesh Visarjan event in Punjab
232.article_body: Singer G Khan has been booked for hurting religious sentiments by allegedly singing 'inappropriate' songs at a Ganesh Visarjan event in Punjab's Ludhiana. G Khan sang songs such as 'Peg Mote Mote Whisky Wale' and 'Choli Ke Peeche Kya Hai' at the gathering. The police also booked Honey Bedi, the son of ex-BJP MLA Harish Bedi, who organised the event.

233.title: Dalit sisters' family rejects police's 'friendship' claim in Lakhimpur rape case
233.article_body: The family of the two Dalit minor sisters, who were raped and subsequently murdered in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri, rejected the police's claim that the girls were friends with the men who carried out the crime. "Our mother identifies three of the men. But we don't know who the rest are," the victims' brother said. Police have arrested six people.

234.title: Man falls on tracks while boarding moving train in UP, coaches pass over him
234.article_body: A video shows a 28-year-old man lying on railway tracks as a train passes over him in UP's Bhadohi. The incident took place when the man fell on the tracks while boarding the moving train. He reportedly suffered head injury and lost his finger in the incident. Video shows blood on the man's head and hands after he got up.

235.title: Kazakhstan to change name of capital from Nur-sultan back to Astana
235.article_body: Kazakhstan President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev has agreed to restore the name of the Kazakhstan capital from Nur-Sultan to Astana. The city was renamed Nur-Sultan three years ago by Tokayev to honour his predecessor Nursultan Nazarbayev after he stepped down in 2019. Tokayev's spokesman, Ruslan Zheliban, said the President agreed to restore the name after an initiative by a group of MPs.

236.title: Exposes govt's claims in matter of women's safety: Mayawati on Lakhimpur incident
236.article_body: Reacting to the alleged rape and murder of two minor Dalit sisters in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri, BSP chief Mayawati on Thursday said criminals are roaming fearlessly in the state because the priorities of the government are wrong. "This incident strongly exposes the claims of the government in the matter of law and order and women's safety," Mayawati tweeted.

237.title: Pogba's elder brother taken into police custody over extortion of Juve midfielder
237.article_body: French authorities have reportedly taken Mathias Pogba, the elder brother of Juventus midfielder Paul Pogba, into custody over the organised armed extortion of the former Manchester United footballer. Pogba has alleged that an organised gang, involving his brother, had demanded €13-million from him. According to reports, three other people are also in custody in connection with the case.

238.title: Using female police officer to stop me part of bigger ploy: BJP's Suvendu
238.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari said using a female police officer to stop him during BJP's march to West Bengal secretariat was part of a "bigger ploy". This comes after a video went viral wherein Adhikari was seen telling the officer, "Do not touch my body. You're female." "Had I retaliated...they would've got a chance to defame...and book me," Adhikari added.

239.title: K'taka man rolls on road to protest against potholes; video emerges
239.article_body: A social worker named Nityananda rolled on a stretch of road to protest against potholes in Karnataka's Udupi on Tuesday. He began his protest by breaking a coconut and offering 'aarti' to potholes of Indrali bridge. A video showed Nityananda, clad in a saffron kurta, rolling on a potholed and muddy road with the sound of drumbeats in the background.

240.title: Work & personal life is separate: Shruti on working with partner Santanu
240.article_body: Shruti Haasan spoke about collaborating with boyfriend and visual artiste Santanu Hazarika for her single 'She is a Hero'. "I don't take his artistry for granted ever. To have him be a part of this project and in the way in which he lent himself is brilliant," she said. Shruti said for them, their "work and personal life is separate".

241.title: Tesla sued in US for deceptive advertising of its Full Self-Driving tech
241.article_body: Tesla was sued in a US court on Wednesday for deceptively advertising its Full Self-Driving and Autopilot technology since 2016 as fully functioning or "just around the corner", despite knowing it didn't work. The plaintiff, Briggs Matsko, said Tesla did this to "generate excitement" about its vehicles. "Tesla...yet to produce anything even remotely approaching a fully self-driving car," he said.

242.title: Delhi govt to organise blood donation camps at over 50 spots on Sep 28
242.article_body: To mark the birth anniversary of revolutionary freedom fighter Bhagat Singh, the Delhi government will organise blood donation camps at over 50 locations in Delhi on September 28, Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal said on Thursday. Adding that Bhagat Singh has inspired generations of youth, he appealed to youths across the country to donate blood as a tribute to him.

243.title: Fed up of husband's extramarital affair, woman kills self in Pune
243.article_body: A woman died by suicide at her parent's house in Pune after being fed up of her husband's extramarital affair and harassment. Police investigation has found that the victim was harassed, beaten up and starved for many days by her husband and was forced to leave his house. Police have booked her husband, who runs a jewellery shop in Delhi.

244.title: Nora Fatehi appears before Delhi Police for questioning in ₹200-cr money laundering case
244.article_body: Actress Nora Fatehi today appeared before the Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of Delhi Police in connection with the ₹200-crore money laundering case involving jailed conman Sukesh Chandrashekhar. This comes a day after the Delhi Police EOW officials summoned actor Jacqueline Fernandez in the same case. Jacqueline was grilled for over 8 hours and was given a list of 100 questions.

245.title: Murderous thug: Amit Malviya on TMC MP's 'police could've fired bullets' remark
245.article_body: BJP leader Amit Malviya on Thursday criticised TMC MP Abhishek Banerjee for his "police could've fired bullets instead of using teargas" remark in connection with BJP's 'Nabanna Cholo' march. "This murderous thug is more than just Mamata Banerjee's nephew," Malviya said. "He holds unconstitutional sway over her government," he added. Abhishek Banerjee had said that police chose to show restraint.

246.title: Truly in awe: Halle on Black girls' reactions to 'The Little Mermaid' teaser
246.article_body: Hollywood actress Halle Bailey is in "awe" about how young Black girls are reacting to the teaser of her film, 'The Little Mermaid'. Re-sharing a compilation video, which features some young girls' reactions to the teaser, Bailey tweeted, "People have been sending these reactions to me all weekend and I'm in truly in awe. This means the world to me."

247.title: Dutch students create 3D-printed EV that captures more carbon than it emits
247.article_body: A team of students at Netherlands' Eindhoven University of Technology has created an electric vehicle (EV) which captures more carbon than it emits. Called ZEM (zero emission mobility), it runs on a lithium-ion battery pack and most of its parts are 3D-printed from recycled plastics. ZEM can capture up to two kg carbon dioxide (CO2) over 20,000 miles of driving.

248.title: Gurugram woman falls out of moving auto while fighting off phone snatcher
248.article_body: A 40-year-old woman sustained serious injuries after falling out of a moving auto-rickshaw while fighting off a biker who tried to snatch her mobile phone, police said. "Gurugram is a very unsafe city. I was lucky no other vehicle was behind the auto, otherwise I would have been crushed," the victim said in a statement.

249.title: Nearly 1 in 5 news videos on TikTok contain misinformation: Report
249.article_body: TikTok search results for prominent news topics like Russia-Ukraine war, COVID-19 and climate change contain misinformation, according to a report by NewsGuard. Researchers found that nearly one of the five news videos automatically suggested by the platform had misinformation. "We don't allow harmful misinformation...and we'll remove it from the platform," TikTok said in response to the report.

250.title: 13-yr-old kidnapped, gang-raped in Hyderabad; 2 arrested
250.article_body: A 13-year-old girl was allegedly kidnapped and gang-raped in Hyderabad's Old City by two persons. As per the victim's mother, the girl went out to buy medicine when the accused forcibly pushed her in the car and later drugged and raped her and left the girl near her house after two days. The two alleged offenders have been detained.

251.title: Don't scream, then you'll say actors have bad manners: Taapsee to reporter in viral video
251.article_body: A video has gone viral showing actress Taapsee Pannu asking a reporter to not scream while asking her questions during media interaction at OTT Play Awards 2022. "Don't scream, then you will say that actors have bad manners," Taapsee was heard saying in the video. Taapsee was then heard asking the reporter to do homework before asking her questions.

252.title: Special status to all backward states if we form govt: Nitish
252.article_body: Special category status will be given to all backward states if the Opposition parties form the government at the Centre, said Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Thursday. "There is no reason why it cannot be done," Kumar told journalists at an event in Patna. Notably, Kumar recently met with leaders of several political parties seeking to unite the Opposition.

253.title: B'luru woman, daughter kill selves after family refuse to give away dog
253.article_body: A Bengaluru-based woman and her 13-year-old daughter allegedly died by suicide after her husband and in-laws refused to give their pet dog away for her health concern. Reportedly, the 36-year-old woman had breathing problems and skin allergy and a doctor had advised her to stay away from dogs. Police have registered a case of abetment to suicide against her husband.

254.title: Standing room tickets for India-Pakistan T20 WC 2022 match sold out within minutes: ICC
254.article_body: The standing room tickets for India-Pakistan T20 World Cup 2022 match were snapped up within minutes of going on sale, the ICC said. This comes days after the general tickets for the match were sold within five minutes. An official re-sale platform will be launched closer to the event, where fans can exchange tickets at face value, the ICC added.

255.title: Ben van Beurden to step down as Shell CEO after 10 years
255.article_body: Shell CEO Ben van Beurden will step down from his role at the end of 2022 after nearly 10 years. He will be succeeded by Wael Sawan, the firm's head of gas and renewables. Beurden, who joined Shell in 1983, will remain as adviser to the board until June 30, 2023, after which he will leave the company.

256.title: Great try but not a successful one: Erica on 'Brahmastra'
256.article_body: Actress Erica Fernandes recently shared her opinion on 'Brahmastra' and said that while the film is a "great try", it isn't a successful one. She said she wished the makers had put more efforts into training the actors for this kind of filmmaking. "Everyone learns from their mistakes and I hope some good comes out of this too," she added.

257.title: Royal Enfield maker Eicher Motors enters ₹1-trillion m-cap club
257.article_body: Shares of Royal Enfield parent, Eicher Motors Limited, surged by 41% so far this year and the firm became India's fifth auto company to join the ₹1 trillion market capital club. Eicher Motors' stock hit a record high of ₹3,659.45 a share on Thursday and gained nearly 3.31% from its previous close with a market cap of ₹1.01 trillion.

258.title: 5 killed, 12 injured as bus falls into gorge in J&K's Rajouri
258.article_body: As many as five persons were killed and 12 others were injured when the bus they were travelling in fell into a gorge in J&K's Rajouri. The bus was on its way to Jammu from Surankote Poonch. "Deeply pained by the news of another tragic road accident in Rajouri at Deri Ralyote (Manjakote)," Jammu Mayor Chander Mohan Gupta tweeted.

259.title: OnePlus launches OnePlus 10R Prime Blue Edition in India
259.article_body: OnePlus has announced the OnePlus 10R Prime Blue Edition in India. The smartphone offers a 3-month Prime membership at no extra cost, celebrating the long-standing partnership with Amazon. The smartphone comes equipped with 80W SUPERVOOC charging, a 6.7-inch 120Hz AMOLED display with a 1080p resolution, HDR10+ support, OxygenOS 12.1 and more.

260.title: Apple website down for some users ahead of iPhone 14 series sale on Sept 16
260.article_body: Apple’s website is down for some users across the world. Several people took to Twitter to share screenshots of the website which either showed a '403 error' or was unable to fully load the images. This comes a day ahead of the sale of its three new iPhones- iPhone 14, iPhone 14 Pro and iPhone 14 Pro Max.

261.title: Bengaluru's tech park admits to encroaching on stormwater drains
261.article_body: Bengaluru's Bagmane World Technology Centre, which includes companies like Accenture, Boeing and DELL, admitted to encroaching on stormwater drains in east Bengaluru. "Yes, we have covered the storm water drain with slabs," Bagmane's general manager said. "We did that only to stop back flow of water from Mahadevapura lake...Main culprit here is Puravankara Purvaridge Villas," the manager added.

262.title: Had some chats with McCullum, he has been, 'stop fearing getting out': Pope
262.article_body: England batter Ollie Pope has said he has enjoyed batting at number three in Tests with coach Brendon McCullum helping him to overcome his fear of losing wicket in the longest format of the game. "I think I was almost putting myself under too much pressure and fear of getting out was probably getting a bit too much," stated Pope.

263.title: 7 arrested for setting police vehicle on fire during Nabanna protest in WB
263.article_body: West Bengal's Kolkata Police on Wednesday night arrested seven people accused of setting a police vehicle on fire on Tuesday during BJP's 'Nabanna Abhiyan' protest. "Those arrested include the one who was carrying the lighter and had started burning the vehicle," police said. Notably, over 112 people have been arrested in connection with the violence during BJP's march.

264.title: 6 Mumbai locals plying on intervening night of Sept 15-16 cancelled
264.article_body: Six Mumbai local trains will remain cancelled for four hours on the intervening night of September 15 and 16 due to maintenance work at Delisle Road Overbridge in Lower Parel, Western Railway (WR) officials informed. "This will lead to Borivali-Churchgate slow local departing from Borivali at 00.30 hrs (midnight) running as extra fast local between Andheri–Bandra–Dadar–Mumbai Central," WR said.

265.title: Russian President Putin's limousine attacked in assassination attempt: Reports
265.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin's limousine was attacked in an assassination attempt, according to reports citing information from the General GVR Telegram channel. Putin's limousine was reportedly hit by a "loud bang" on its left front wheel followed by heavy smoke. In 2017, Putin publicly disclosed that he has survived at least five assassination attempts.

266.title: Concrete slab falls off flyover in Mumbai's Bandra, causes panic
266.article_body: A concrete slab fell off a flyover in Mumbai's Bandra area on Wednesday, causing panic among the residents. It was one of the many slabs placed to hold beautification pots on the Mahim connector. Although no one was injured, the residents expressed concern about potential accidents. Following the incident, the authorities decided to remove all such slabs from the flyover.

267.title: What is Ethereum Merge, an energy saving upgrade that has been completed?
267.article_body: Ethereum, the second-largest blockchain network, has completed a massive upgrade that will help the blockchain run efficiently while adding new features. Called the Merge, it represents the Ethereum network's shift to proof-of-stake (PoS), its new system to authenticate transactions by replacing proof-of-work (PoW). Merge will result in a 99.95% reduction in Ethereum's energy consumption.

268.title: Why heinous crimes against women rising in UP?: Priyanka on Lakhimpur incident
268.article_body: Reacting to the alleged rape and murder of two minor Dalit sisters in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri, Congress leader Priyanka Gandhi Vadra asked, "Why are heinous crimes against women increasing in UP?" Priyanka tweeted, "The killings of the two sisters in Lakhimpur is heartbreaking…Law and order in the state doesn’t improve by giving false advertisements in newspapers and TV everyday."

269.title: Can't expect women's safety from those facilitating rapists' release: Rahul
269.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday criticised BJP over the kidnapping and murder of two Dalit girls in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri district and described the incident as "very disturbing". "Women's safety cannot be expected from those facilitating the release of rapists," Rahul tweeted while referring to the release of 11 convicts in the Bilkis Bano gang-rape case.

270.title: MI Cape Town name Simon Katich as head coach, Hashim Amla as batting coach
270.article_body: Former Australia cricketer Simon Katich has been appointed as the head coach of MI Cape Town for the inaugural season of SA20. Katich will be joined by former South Africa batter Hashim Amla as the team's batting coach and ex-New Zealand cricketer James Pamment as fielding coach. Notably, Pamment is also the fielding coach of IPL franchise MI.

271.title: Nick Cannon welcomes his 9th child while expecting two babies with 2 other women
271.article_body: Actor Nick Cannon has welcomed his ninth child and his first with model LaNisha Cole. In June, Cannon confirmed that he is expecting a child with Abby De La Rosa. Last month, Cannon, who welcomed a baby with model Bre Tiesi in July, took to social media to announce that he is expecting his third child with model Brittany Bell.

272.title: Qatar school shut after 4-yr-old Indian girl dies in bus
272.article_body: A private school in Qatar has been closed after the death of a four-year-old Indian student, Qatar's Education Ministry said. The move comes after an investigation revealed negligence among its workers, "who were subjected to...most severe penalties", it added. Minsa Jacob, who hailed from Kerala, died on her birthday after being left inside her school bus for over four hours.

273.title: Dr Anahita, driver of car that crashed killing Mistry, undergoes pelvic reconstruction
273.article_body: Dr Anahita Pandole, who was driving the car that crashed into a divider killing former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry and injuring her and her husband, was operated for pelvic reconstruction in Mumbai. Notably, Dr Peter V Giannoudis, Chairman of Academic Department of Trauma and Orthopaedic Surgery at University of Leeds, UK, was flown to Mumbai for his expert advice.

274.title: Woman with toy gun breaks into bank to get her trapped savings in Beirut; pics viral
274.article_body: Amid the economic crisis in Lebanon, a woman carrying a toy pistol broke into a Beirut bank, taking $13,000 from her trapped savings. Sali Hafez said she needed the money to fund her sister's cancer treatment. Hafez repeatedly visited the bank to ask for her money and was told she could only receive $200 a month in Lebanese pounds.

275.title: Sonam is going to make for a really fun mom: Swara Bhasker
275.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker said Sonam Kapoor and Anand Ahuja are going "to make great parents". She said Sonam is "going to make for a really fun mom". Adding that she's a "funny person", Swara added she is sure that Sonam will have many stories to tell about her son. Sonam gave birth to a baby boy on August 20.

276.title: 2 terrorists involved in migrant's death killed in encounter in J&K
276.article_body: Two terrorists, involved in the death of a migrant labourer from West Bengal, were killed in encounter with Jammu and Kashmir Police in the Nowgam area of Srinagar on Wednesday night. According to police, the terrorists were affiliated with the outfit Ansar Ghazwat-ul-Hind (AGuH). An AK rifle, two pistols and other war-like stores were also recovered from the spot.

277.title: BJP takes out all-women bike rally to mark 'Hyderabad Liberation Day'
277.article_body: The BJP Mahila Morcha took out an all-women bike rally from Bhagya Laxmi Temple at Charminar on Thursday on occasion of 'Hyderabad Liberation Day'. Union Minister G Kishan Reddy also participated in the rally. The bike rally will pass through areas like Gulzar House, Madina building, Afzalgunj Library, Ramkoti, King Koti, Narayanguda, Secunderabad, Musheerabad, etc.

278.title: 16-yr-old UP girl fights e-rickshaw driver, others to avoid abduction
278.article_body: A 16-year-old girl fought against three persons - an e-rickshaw driver and two of his friends - to escape a kidnapping attempt by them in UP's Bahraich district on Tuesday. After freeing herself, the teenager reached a local police station and filed a complaint. She said the incident happened when she took an e-rickshaw on her way home from school.

279.title: Repetition of Hathras daughter's murder: Akhilesh on Lakhimpur incident
279.article_body: Reacting to the alleged rape and murder of two minor Dalit sisters in UP's Lakhimpur Kheri, Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav tweeted, "After farmers in Lakhimpur, the killing of Dalits is now a repetition of Hathras daughter's murder." The bodies of two Dalit sisters were found hanging from a tree in Lakhimpur on Wednesday.

280.title: Akshay Kumar to support hairstylist Milan's family: Reports
280.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar has reportedly reached out to the family of his late hairstylist Milan Jadhav and promised to look after them. Akshay and Milan worked together for over 15 years. Earlier on Instagram, Akshay said Milan "stood out of the crowd" because of his "funky hairstyles".

281.title: Go First still working to restore its hacked Twitter account: Official
281.article_body: Go First is still working to restore its official Twitter account which has been hacked, said an airline official on Thursday. On Wednesday, Go First’s Twitter handle was hacked and the name was changed to 'vitalik.eth' along with the picture of Ethereum Co-founder Vitalik Buterin. Notably, this is the second time this year that the handle has been compromised.

282.title: College student held for stalking, sexually assaulting minor in Gurugram
282.article_body: A 19-year-old college student was arrested for allegedly stalking and sexually assaulting a minor girl in Gurugram, police said. "According to the complainant...accused passed out of school last year and joined a college and used to call her often," police added. "It was further alleged that the accused had been...threatening to share her nude photographs on social media," police stated.

283.title: Wish it had worked good: Nagarjuna on 'Laal Singh Chaddha'
283.article_body: Nagarjuna Akkineni reacted to the failure of 'Laal Singh Chaddha', which marked his son Naga Chaitanya's Hindi debut. He said his family has four actors, and every year, they share "bittersweet moments", and the box office performance of 'Laal Singh Chaddha' was one such incident. Nagarjuna added, "I wish it had worked good. But it happens, it is an experience."

284.title: Tencent Music to debut in Hong Kong Stock Exchange next week
284.article_body: China's Tencent Music Entertainment Group's shares will start trading on the Hong Kong Stock Exchange next Wednesday after the company carries out a secondary listing by introduction, it said. It has joined many US-listed Chinese firms that have opted for a second listing in Hong Kong. Tencent Music said that New York Stock Exchange will remain its primary listing venue.

285.title: E-bike battery blast may have led to Hyderabad fire: Police
285.article_body: The fire in a Secunderabad hotel that claimed lives of eight people on Monday night is likely to have started from an electric scooter that was being charged in the basement, a senior Hyderabad Police officer said based on CCTV footage. Absence of required permissions for hotel and showroom, and misuse of parking space were major lapses, DCP Chandana said.

286.title: US returns 2000-year-old coin worth $1 million to Israel
286.article_body: The US has returned "an exceedingly rare" quarter shekel, valued up to $1 million, to Israel in a ceremony in New York. The coin was minted as an act of defiance by Jewish rebels against the Roman Empire over 2,000 years ago. The coin was reportedly looted in 2002 and has now returned to Israel following an international recovery effort.

287.title: Dalits, Adivasis, Muslims face discrimination in jobs: Oxfam India
287.article_body: Dalits, Adivasis and Muslims in the country face discrimination when it comes to employment, a report by NGO Oxfam India showed. Titled 'India Discrimination Report 2022', the report said that SC/ST people and Muslims earn less than those not belonging to the groups respectively. "The lower employment for urban Muslims attributes 68% to discrimination," said the report.

288.title: Anahita, who was in car with Mistry, operated for pelvic reconstruction; UK doctor flown in
288.article_body: Dr Anahita Pandole was operated for pelvic reconstruction at a Mumbai hospital after she and her husband Darius Pandole were injured in a car crash that killed former Tata Sons Chairman Cyrus Mistry. Notably, Dr Peter V Giannoudis, Chairman of Academic Department of Trauma and Orthopedics Surgery at University of Leeds, UK, was flown to Mumbai for his expert advice.

289.title: When we don't let audience down, they applaud: Pooja on 'Brahmastra' success
289.article_body: Commenting on the success of 'Brahmastra: Part One Shiva', Pooja Bhatt said the hate against it existed only on social media. She said she experienced the audience being entertained and "responding completely" to the film in a theatre. "When we let them down, they let us know. When we don't, they applaud and give us so much love," she added.

290.title: Symbols of pure evil: Goa Forward Party chief after 8 Goa Cong MLAs join BJP
290.article_body: After eight Goa Congress MLAs joined BJP on Wednesday, Goa Forward Party chief Vijai Sardesai said that they stand as the "symbols of pure evil". "The eight legislators who have decided…to pursue their greed for wealth and hunger for power, stand today as symbols of pure evil, displaying their shameless selfishness…in defiance of Almighty God," he added.

291.title: Pune's PCMC sends seizure warnings to 31,971 property tax defaulters
291.article_body: Pune's Pimpri-Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) sent seizure warnings to as many as 31,971 property tax defaulters, officials said. It warned them of confiscating their properties if they don't pay their dues. As many as 3,850 property owners have so far not paid even one rupee in tax, officials added. "Action against tax defaulters...in three stages," a PCMC official said.

292.title: Fitch cuts India's growth forecast for 2022-23 to 7% from 7.8%
292.article_body: Fitch Ratings has cut India's growth forecast for the current financial year to 7% from the previous estimate of 7.8%. It further cut its GDP growth forecast for the next fiscal year to 6.7% from the earlier estimate of 7.4%. The rating agency's growth estimate for FY23 is lower than the Reserve Bank of India's forecast of 7.2%.

293.title: Harsha Engineers IPO fully subscribed on Day 1, bought 5.08 times on Day 2
293.article_body: Harsha Engineers International's IPO was fully subscribed on the first day with 1.92 times the subscription on Wednesday. On the second day of bidding on Thursday, investors bought 8.55 crore equity shares against an offer size of 1.68 crore, which is 5.08 times the subscription. The IPO is worth ₹755 crore comprising fresh issue and offer-for-sale part.

294.title: Woman carrying skull-less foetus forced to travel 2,250 km to terminate pregnancy in US
294.article_body: A pregnant woman carrying a skull-less foetus that had no chance of survival was forced to travel over 2,250 kilometres to New York for an abortion after she was refused care in Louisiana, her home state. Nancy Davis said she was denied an abortion because of confusion around Louisiana's anti-abortion law introduced after US Supreme Court overturned Roe v Wade.

295.title: 17 people fined for not wearing rear seat belts in Delhi
295.article_body: The Delhi Traffic Police on Wednesday issued challans to 17 people for not wearing seat belts in the backseat of vehicles. The drive was carried out on Barakhamba Road between 11 am and 1 pm, Deputy Commissioner of Police (Traffic) Aalap Patel said. As per the Motor Vehicles Act, passengers not wearing rear seat belts can be fined upto ₹1,000.

296.title: Tamilnad Mercantile Bank makes market debut at 2.9% discount
296.article_body: Tamilnad Mercantile Bank made its market debut on Thursday at a discount of 2.94% to the issue price. The stock was listed at ₹510 apiece on the BSE and at ₹495 on the NSE against the issue price of ₹510 apiece. Its IPO had seen 2.86 times the subscription during September 5-7 and it has mobilised ₹831.6 crore.

297.title: Man tags Aviation Ministry to complain about 'unfair' iPad pricing, ministry replies
297.article_body: A Twitter user, while sharing a screenshot of an iPad pricing, tagged the Ministry of Civil Aviation instead of the Ministry of Consumer Affairs and wrote, "iPad Pro 11-inch was never of ₹1,76,900. @MoCA_GoI please take action for unfair trade practices." Meanwhile, the ministry replied to him, "We intend to help, but we're busy providing affordable air travel to India."

298.title: UP govt suspends official over order to include Urdu in nameplates at health centres
298.article_body: Yogi Adityanath-led Uttar Pradesh government has suspended Joint Director (Health), Dr Tabassum Khan, over a September 1 order directing all district health centres to include signboards and nameplates also in Urdu. The government said it has found Dr Khan "prima facie" guilty of "grave indiscipline" by issuing the order "on her own without getting it approved from the appropriate level".

299.title: Why don't we criticise 'Avengers' or 'Iron Man': Actor on Brahmastra's plot
299.article_body: 'Brahmastra Part One: Shiva' actor Saqib Ayub has defended the film's plot and said it is similar to any superhero movie. Stating examples of 'Avengers', 'Thor' and 'Iron Man', Saqib questioned why these films are not criticised when even they have the same story. "Brahmastra has a different theme and different powers, so the narrative is different," he said.

300.title: Virat Kohli might take retirement after 2022 T20 World Cup: Shoaib Akhtar
300.article_body: After ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi's retirement advice to Virat Kohli, former pacer Shoaib Akhtar has predicted that Kohli might retire from T20Is after the upcoming World Cup in Australia to extend his "longevity in the other formats". "If I [were] him, I would have looked at the larger picture and taken a call," stated Akhtar.

301.title: On Hindi Diwas, Karnataka CM promises law to make Kannada mandatory
301.article_body: Amid protests over celebration of Hindi Diwas on Wednesday, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said his government will bring a law to make Kannada mandatory in the state. The statement came after former CM HD Kumaraswamy staged a protest against Hindi imposition during the Assembly session. "There is no compromise when it comes to protecting the interests of Karnataka," said Bommai.

302.title: Delhi Excise Dept exploring ways to dispose of 70 Lakh unsold liquor bottles
302.article_body: The Delhi government's excise department is exploring ways to dispose of 70 lakh bottles of leftover liquor and roll them over for sale under the current excise regime, officials said. They further said that the stock, also comprising wine and beer, is stored at warehouses as it could not be sold under Excise Policy 2021-22 which ended on August 31.

303.title: Chris Hemsworth has incredible comedic talent: Natalie Portman
303.article_body: Natalie Portman said her 'Thor: Love and Thunder' co-star Chris Hemsworth has an "incredible comedic talent" and "a quick brain" for reacting creatively and coming up with new ideas. Calling his commitment to work "impressive to watch", Natalie said she often has to remind herself that she has to act in a scene and "can't just be an audience".

304.title: Armenia, Azerbaijan agree on ceasefire after deadly clashes
304.article_body: Armenia and Azerbaijan have reached a ceasefire following two days of fighting that has killed 155 soldiers from both sides, an Armenian official said. The ceasefire came into effect from 8 pm local time on Wednesday, Armen Grigoryan, Armenia's Security Council's Secretary, added. The recent fighting between the countries is the worst since 2020 war over the disputed Nagorno-Karabakh region.

305.title: 2 minor Dalit sisters raped and murdered in UP, bodies found hanging on tree; 6 arrested
305.article_body: The bodies of two Dalit sisters, aged 15 and 17, were found hanging from a tree in Uttar Pradesh's Lakhimpur Kheri on Wednesday. Six accused named Chotu, Junaid, Sohail, Hafizul, Karimuddin and Arif were arrested. Police said Sohail and Junaid raped them and after the girls demanded that the accused marry them, Sohail, Hafizul and Junaid strangulated and killed them.

306.title: Pak actress criticised for throwing plastic in river, says 'COVID has affected my brain'
306.article_body: After she was criticised for throwing plastic bags in a river, Pakistani actress Resham said that it happened because COVID-19 has affected her brain twice. "I have had COVID-19 twice and its effects are still there. This is why I did not realise what I was going to do and threw the bags in recklessness," she added.

307.title: 2 acquitted from charges of rioting, torching house in 2020 Delhi riots
307.article_body: A court acquitted two persons from charges of rioting and torching a house during 2020 Delhi riots. "Prosecution hasn't been able to prove its case...beyond reasonable doubt which is the touchstone of criminal law," it said. "On the cumulative reading of the entire testimonies...presence of accused in the unlawful assembly...participation in the act of rioting...not established at all," it added.

308.title: All mosques should be moved away from temples: UP minister
308.article_body: UP Cabinet Minister Sanjay Nishad on Wednesday said that all mosques that are in close proximity to temples should be voluntarily shifted away. He said that just as what happened in the case of Ram Mandir, mosques near every temple should be removed. He added that "we" don't need to move, others can rather construct their place of worship elsewhere.

309.title: Mumbai to witness heavy rainfall in next 48 hours: IMD
309.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted that Mumbai and its suburbs will receive moderate to heavy rainfall in the next 48 hours. The weather agency has issued an orange alert for Mumbai today. According to the IMD, the temperature in the city is expected to hover around 25 degrees Celsius to 30 degrees Celsius over the next two days.

310.title: Encroachment of nullahs main reason for flooding in Pune: PMC report
310.article_body: A Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) site report has revealed that most areas in the city got flooded due to illegal encroachment of nullahs. Following the report, the additional municipal commissioner instructed the building permission department to file a report on how permissions were granted for such constructions. This comes after several areas in Pune got flooded following rainfall on Sunday.

311.title: Who is Yvon Chouinard, the billionaire donating his company to fight climate crisis?
311.article_body: American billionaire Yvon Chouinard, the Founder of fashion retailer Patagonia, has donated his $3 billion-company to fight the climate crisis. Chouinard, a former rock climber, has an estimated net worth of $1.2 billion and has long championed environmental causes. Previously, he said that he didn't want to become a businessman and reportedly doesn't own a computer or a mobile phone.

312.title: Was nervous going back on set for 'Made In Heaven 2': Neelam Kothari
312.article_body: Neelam Kothari Soni has said she was nervous about going on sets for 'Made In Heaven 2'. "It was like, 'OMG I'm actually back in front of the camera'," she said. Neelam said she was "grateful" to have her husband Samir Soni on the sets. She added it was "great fun" to shoot with him and Sanjay Kapoor.

313.title: BJP, RSS spreading violence contrary to teachings of social reformers: Rahul
313.article_body: Congress' Rahul Gandhi said BJP and RSS are spreading violence, hatred and anger in country, which is contrary to teachings of renowned social reformers. He added that social reformers like Sree Narayana Guru, Ayyankali and Chattampi Swamikal didn't preach violence. "The BJP and RSS ideology is one of hatred and anger which [is] dividing and weakening the country," he stated.

314.title: Well played, loved calling your graceful batting: Bhogle on Uthappa's retirement
314.article_body: Reacting to cricketer Robin Uthappa announcing his retirement from all forms of Indian cricket, commentator Harsha Bhogle tweeted, "Well played Uthappa. Loved calling your graceful batting. You have had such an eventful career and you gave a lot of joy." Bhogle added, "Gambhir and Uthappa will always be one of the best combinations in the IPL."

315.title: Projects don't go out of hand in 1-2 months: Maha CM on Vedanta project
315.article_body: After Opposition party leaders criticised Eknath Shinde-led Maharashtra government after Vedanta-Foxconn project was shifted to Gujarat, Maharashtra CM said that such projects don't go out of hand in one or two months. "The company had already made up its mind and may have thought the [previous MVA] government would not help. They didn't know the government would change," he added.

316.title: No efforts must be made to make India 'Hindia': TN CM Stalin
316.article_body: Reacting to Union Minister Amit Shah's comment on Hindi language, Tamil Nadu CM on Wednesday said all Indian languages day should be celebrated rather than just Hindi Diwas. "India is known for its integrity...there must not be any efforts aimed at dividing country in name of 'Hindia'...[Amit] Shah's Hindi pitch went against country's ideal of unity in diversity," he added.

317.title: Data engineering firm Sigmoid raises $12 mn from Sequoia Capital
317.article_body: Data engineering startup Sigmoid has raised $12 million in a Series B financing round from Sequoia Capital India. Sequoia has invested $19.3 million into Sigmoid till now. Sigmoid was founded by Indian Institute of Technology (IIT) alumni Lokesh Anand, Mayur Rustagi and Rahul Singh in 2013 and provides analytics and AI solutions to firms across the world.

318.title: Jharkhand raises OBC reservation in state government jobs to 27% from 14%
318.article_body: Hemant Soren-led Jharkhand government raised the OBC reservation in the state government jobs to 27% from 14%. The cabinet approved a proposal granting 77% reservation in state government jobs for the members of the SC, ST, backward classes, OBC and economically weaker sections. Jharkhand cabinet also gave its nod to use the 1932 land records to determine local inhabitants.

319.title: Photo with 'private parts' visible morphed, not part of nude shoot: Ranveer Singh to police
319.article_body: Ranveer Singh has told Mumbai Police that one of the photos, based on which an FIR was registered against him on charges of obscenity, was morphed. An officer said that Ranveer claimed in his statement that the photograph, in which the complainant had alleged his 'private parts were visible', was morphed and not part of the photoshoot for Paper magazine.

320.title: Putin doesn't believe Ukraine invasion a mistake: German Chancellor
320.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin "unfortunately" doesn't think he committed a "mistake" by invading Ukraine, German Chancellor Olaf Scholz said on Wednesday. Scholz made these comments after he had a 90-minute-long telephonic conversation with the Russian leader on Tuesday. The exit of Russian troops from Ukraine was the only way for "peace to have a chance in the region", he added.

321.title: CM KCR's family has a role in Delhi liquor scam: T'gana BJP chief
321.article_body: Telangana BJP chief Bandi Sanjay Kumar claimed that CM K Chandrashekar Rao has a role in the alleged Delhi liquor scam. "[KCR's] family has a role in all scams including land, sand and liquor," Sanjay said, alleging that the Chief Minister asked for bribes to provide houses to poor people. "After...BJP government comes, we'll build houses for all," Sanjay added.

322.title: Won't be surprised if BJP gives Mumbai to Guj: Patole on Vedanta project
322.article_body: Congress' Nana Patole criticised Maharashtra BJP leaders over Vedanta group choosing Gujarat to start a semiconductor unit. "Maharashtra BJP leaders are looting the state...giving it to Gujarat to get blessings of their leaders in Delhi. The company that went would've made over ₹1 lakh crore of investment. It won't be surprising if they give even Mumbai to Gujarat," Patole added.

323.title: Pune civic body plans to set up hydropower project at Bund Garden
323.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is planning to set up a hydropower project at Bund Garden. It has identified a site for the project on the Mula-Mutha river. "We aim to generate 300 kW energy every year," said a PMC official. Experts estimate that the installation cost would be recovered within six to seven years of completion of the project.

324.title: SBI hikes Benchmark Prime Lending Rate by 70 bps to 13.45% from today
324.article_body: SBI has raised the Benchmark Prime Lending Rate (BPLR) by 70 basis points or 0.7% to 13.45% effective from Thursday, September 15. This would make loan repayment linked to BPLR costlier. Earlier in August, SBI raised its benchmark lending rates by up to 50 basis points or 0.5%. The bank also raised the Base Rate to 8.7%, effective Thursday.

325.title: SL shouldn't be looking at anything other than winning T20 WC: Jayawardena
325.article_body: Ex-Sri Lanka captain Mahela Jayawardena has said the Dasun Shanaka-led side shouldn't be looking at anything other than winning the T20 World Cup in Australia. "That's the attitude to have and this is a group I feel that they will play with no fear," added Jayawardena. Sri Lanka recently won the Asia Cup 2022 after defeating Pakistan in the final.

326.title: Lived here for years, evicted in mins: B'luru residents affected by demolition
326.article_body: As BBMP is carrying out a demolition drive in several areas of Bengaluru to remove illegal structures after the flood water receded, residents affected by demolition shared their experiences. A resident, whose house was demolished in Munnekolala, said that they have been living there for 10 years and suddenly they were asked to vacate the home in five minutes.

327.title: India reports 6,422 new COVID-19 cases, daily positivity rate stands at 2.04%
327.article_body: India reported 6,422 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Union Health Ministry. This comes a day after the country recorded 5,108 fresh COVID-19 cases. Following 5,748 recoveries in the last 24 hours, the active cases in the country now stand at 46,389. The daily positivity rate currently stands at 2.04%.

328.title: I have not returned empty-handed from India: Bangladesh PM Hasina
328.article_body: Bangladeshi PM Sheikh Hasina on Wednesday said that her recent four-day visit to India benefitted Bangladesh. "They [India] have shown much sincerity and I haven't returned empty-handed...I think...my visit...has opened a new horizon in Bangladesh-India relations," she added. During Hasina's visit, India and Bangladesh signed seven agreements, including one on sharing of waters of Kushiyara river.

329.title: Helping 2000+ professionals in switching to Data Science career: Scaler
329.article_body: Scaler shared that its Data Science and ML with Analytics program is helping 2000+ working professionals switch their career to data science. With a chance to learn hands-on with 80+ business case studies, more working professionals are choosing this online course without quitting jobs, said Scaler. Scaler's Free Live Class is the best place to start your transition, it stated.

330.title: 7-yr-old kidnapped girl rescued within 2 hrs in Delhi, accused arrested
330.article_body: A Delhi Police constable rescued a seven-year-old girl and arrested a 22-year-old man who had kidnapped her from east Delhi. The girl was kidnapped on September 11, and within two hours she was rescued while being taken away in an auto-rickshaw, police said. The accused had allegedly kidnapped her with an intent to sexually assault her, police added.

331.title: Harassed by rivals, Thane cable operator jumps before train, dies
331.article_body: A 45-year-old cable operator from Thane's Dombivli, Pralhad Narayan Patil, killed himself by jumping in front of a train on Saturday over alleged harassment from his rivals. The police have booked 15 people for abetment. "All the 15 accused had also started a cable operating business in Sandap village and they allegedly harassed Patil," said a police official.

332.title: Police release photos of suspects who opened fire in Begusarai, announce ₹50,000 bounty
332.article_body: Police have released photos of bike-borne assailants who opened fire on random people at multiple locations in Bihar's Begusarai. Police have also announced a bounty of ₹50,000 on the accused. At least one person was killed and nine others were injured in the firing. "Some have been released from the hospital," Begusarai SP Yogendra Kumar said.

333.title: India confirms disengagement with Chinese troops at Hot Springs in Ladakh
333.article_body: Minister of External Affairs S Jaishankar on Wednesday confirmed that Indian and Chinese troops have completed the disengagement process at Patrolling Point-15 in the Gogra-Hot Springs area in eastern Ladakh. The minister said, "I would recognise that we had disengagement at PP-15...the disengagement, as I understand, is completed, and that is one problem less on the border."

334.title: Royal guard collapses while protecting the Queen's coffin
334.article_body: A Royal guard fainted and fell off the podium where he was protecting the Queen's coffin. The live stream was cut out for several minutes as police rushed to the guard's aid. Commenting on the video showing the guard collapsing, a social media user wrote, "It's such a massive responsibility. I hope he's fine."

335.title: I believe this Indian team can bring home the T20 WC trophy: Gavaskar
335.article_body: Amid debate over India's 15-member squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup in Australia, ex-India captain Sunil Gavaskar has said he believes that the Rohit Sharma-led side can bring home the trophy. "Once the team is selected, then it's our India team and we all have to back it," he added. The Super 12 stage will begin on October 22.

336.title: MCI, PSG, Madrid register wins in Champions League; Chelsea held to 1-1 draw
336.article_body: Norwegian striker Erling Haaland provided the late winner against his former club Borussia Dortmund as Manchester City won 2-1 in their group stage game on Wednesday night. PSG and Real Madrid also registered wins in their respective games against Maccabi Haifa and Leipzig. Chelsea, however, were held to a 1-1 draw at home against Salzburg.

337.title: PVR investors to offload 7.7% stake via block deal today: Report
337.article_body: PVR's investors will reportedly offload a 7.7% stake in the company via a block deal on Thursday. Multiples PE, Grey Birch, Plenty PE and Berry Invt are among the investors selling stake and the offer price for the block deal may range from ₹1,852-₹1,929 apiece. PVR will also offer up to 4% stake via block deals, a report said.

338.title: No plans to set up unit in Punjab: BMW denies CM Bhagwant Mann's claim
338.article_body: In a statement, German luxury car manufacturer BMW said it has "no plans" to set up a manufacturing unit in Punjab. This comes a day after the Punjab government said the company had agreed to set up its plant after CM Bhagwant Mann showcased the state's "exemplary work" to promote industry, following which BMW decided to install a unit there.

339.title: Woman killed grandmother to rob her to repay loans: Pune Police
339.article_body: After a 70-year-old woman was found dead in Pune's Warje, police arrested her 24-year-old granddaughter on charges of killing her. The woman killed her grandmother to rob her of cash and valuables to repay the loans that she had taken from online credit platforms, police said. Police had found a razor blade next to the body of the deceased.

340.title: Mumbai man loses lakhs in extortion after woman undresses on video call
340.article_body: A 75-year-old Mumbai man was blackmailed into giving ₹2.21 lakh to frauds posing as an IPS officer and a journalist. According to police, he received a video call in which he saw a woman undressing. She asked him to strip as well after which he disconnected the call. He then received calls threatening him of uploading the video online.

341.title: Only 2 hour-long classes in Northeast Delhi govt schools: PIL in HC
341.article_body: A Public Interest Litigation (PIL) moved in Delhi High Court has claimed that some of the Delhi government-run schools in the Northeast district are conducting only two hours of classes. These school hours are in violation of provisions of the Right to Education Act, 2009, the PIL stated. Nearly one lakh students are getting affected, the PIL added.

342.title: If Mamata wants to open fire on protestors, she'll have to leave CM chair: Suvendu
342.article_body: BJP leader Suvendu Adhikari said if West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee wants to "open fire on protestors", she'll have to leave the CM chair. His statement came while reacting to the violence that ensued in BJP's 'Nabanna Cholo' rally on Tuesday. Adhikari said that the party's 'Nabanna Cholo' became a mass movement against corruption and dynastic politics in West Bengal.

343.title: TSRTC starts 4 new buses from Dilsukhnagar to Kokapet in Hyderabad
343.article_body: The Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC) has started four new bus services from Dilsukhnagar to Kokapet in Hyderabad. "Residents of Kokapet, Gandipet, Narsingi and surrounding areas can avail these services, and reach their destinations easily," TSRTC said. The first bus is scheduled to start from Dilsukhnagar at 6 am and the last bus service is at 8:42 pm.

344.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face scheduled power cuts today
344.article_body: The Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) has proposed some scheduled power shutdowns in parts of the city today to carry out maintenance and repair works. Power supply will be hit in the affected areas between 10 am and 4 pm. The areas that will be affected today include Kengeri, Davangere, Madhugiri, Chitradurga, etc.

345.title: Owner of US-based firm donates entire company worth $3 billion to fight climate crisis
345.article_body: The billionaire owner of a US-based sportswear brand is giving away ownership of the brand that started some 50 years ago to a trust that will use its profit to fight the climate crisis. The company, Patagonia, is reportedly worth about $3 billion. "We'll use the wealth Patagonia creates to protect the source of all wealth," said owner Yvon Chouinard.

346.title: Not the first time: Student as SPPU faces 12-hour power cut
346.article_body: The Savitribai Phule Pune University (SPPU) witnessed a power cut for about 12 hours, starting from late Tuesday night to Wednesday afternoon. SPPU Registrar Prafulla Pawar attributed it to the heavy rain. "This is not the first time the issue with the power supply has cropped up…It has become more common in the past few months," said a student.

347.title: We chose Gujarat for semiconductor facility based on independent advice: Vedanta
