347.article_body: Commenting on Vedanta-Foxconn's decision to set up a semiconductor facility in Gujarat instead of Maharashtra, Vedanta Resources Ltd Chairman Anil Agarwal said, "Maharashtra made effort to outbid other states...we chose Gujarat based on independent advice." He added, "We decided on Gujarat earlier...they met our expectations." The company is committed to investing in Maharashtra, Agarwal stated.

348.title: 14-yr-old boy found dead at Mumbai shelter home, case registered
348.article_body: Police have registered a case of abetment to suicide after a 14-year-old boy ended his life at a shelter home in Mumbai. According to police, the boy took the step on Monday after he was allegedly scolded by the class monitor. The incident came to light when another inmate went to use the bathroom, where the deceased was found hanging.

349.title: Swaminarayan temple in Canada vandalised with anti-India graffiti, India issues statement
349.article_body: The BAPS Swaminarayan temple in Toronto, Canada was vandalised with anti-India graffiti. The High Commission of India in Ottawa strongly condemned the incident on Thursday. In a statement issued on Twitter, the High Commission said, "Have requested Canadian authorities to investigate the incident and take prompt action on perpetrators."

350.title: Car crashes into Ukraine President Zelenskyy's car
350.article_body: A car crashed into Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's car in Kyiv, according to a statement from the President's press secretary. "The President was examined by a doctor, no serious injuries were found," the statement said. Medics accompanying Zelenskyy gave emergency aid to the car's driver and transferred him to an ambulance, it added.

351.title: Former ICC elite umpire Asad Rauf passes away aged 66 in Lahore
351.article_body: Former ICC elite umpire Asad Rauf passed away aged 66 in Pakistan's Lahore on Wednesday. As per reports, Rauf died after suffering a heart attack while he was going home from his shop. Rauf had quit umpiring in 2013. He stood as an umpire in 178 international matches and was third umpire in 64 international matches.

352.title: Elon Musk's Starlink arrives in Antarctica, now on all 7 continents
352.article_body: Elon Musk-led SpaceX's Starlink satellite internet service arrived in Antarctica, the National Science Foundation announced on Twitter. It stated Starlink is testing polar service with a newly deployed user terminal at McMurdo Station. "Starlink is now on all seven continents! In such a remote location like Antarctica, this capability is enabled by Starlink's space laser network," SpaceX tweeted.

353.title: ED seizes 91.5 kg of gold, 340 kg of silver worth ₹47 cr from Mumbai firm
353.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate has seized 91.5 kg of gold and 340 kg of silver, collectively worth ₹47.76 crore, as part of a money laundering probe linked to an alleged bank loan fraud case. The premises of Raksha Bullion and Classic Marbles were raided in connection with the case against a company called Parekh Aluminex Ltd., the agency said.

354.title: 6 local trains plying in Mumbai between 1:00-5:00 am on Sept 16 cancelled
354.article_body: A power and traffic block will lead to cancellation of six local trains on the Western Railway between 1:10 am and 5:10 am on September 16. Rail traffic will be blocked on all lines at Lower Parel due to ongoing work at the Delisle Road Overbridge. The work will also cause six local trains to remain partially cancelled.

355.title: Ghaziabad man receives death threat via WhatsApp call, case filed
355.article_body: Ghaziabad Police has registered a case on a complaint filed by a man over allegedly receiving death threats via a WhatsApp call. The cyber cell is verifying the number from which the WhatsApp call was made, said Muniraj G, Senior SP, Ghaziabad. The investigation will reveal if the call came from the US or any other foreign country, he added.

356.title: Lalu Prasad Yadav visits RJD office in Patna after several years
356.article_body: Lalu Prasad Yadav, the founding president of Rashtriya Janata Dal (RJD), visited the party office in Bihar's Patna on Wednesday after a gap of several years due to imprisonment and ill health. "Our national president finalised the programme for [RJD's] national executive...in Delhi next month," senior leaders said after his visit. Notably, Lalu is awaiting a kidney transplant in Singapore.

357.title: India makes its own decisions: US on military drills in Russia
357.article_body: The US has rejected questions on India’s participation in a military exercise hosted by Russia, saying New Delhi makes its own decisions. Pentagon Spokesman Brig Gen Patrick Ryder said the US will continue to work with India. India was among a host of nations to participate in Vostok 2022 exercise, which was held across Russia earlier this month.

358.title: It is policy to provide maintenance: US on jet sustenance programme for Pak
358.article_body: The US has defended approving a $450 million F-16 fighter jet fleet sustenance programme to the Pakistani Air Force, saying it is policy to provide "lifecycle maintenance and sustainment packages for US-origin platforms". US Spokesperson Ned Price said Pakistan is an important counterterrorism partner. The sustenance programme is the US' first major security assistance to Pakistan in four years.

359.title: Partha Chatterjee's bail plea rejected in SSC scam case
359.article_body: A special court in Kolkata on Wednesday rejected the bail plea of former West Bengal minister Partha Chatterjee and sent him to judicial remand till September 28 in the School Service Commission (SSC) recruitment scam case. Notably, Chatterjee broke down during the hearing while pleading for bail. Meanwhile, the court also extended the judicial remand of Chatterjee's aide Arpita Mukherjee.

360.title: 3rd suspect arrested in Argentine VP's attempted assassination
360.article_body: A third suspect has been arrested in the attempted assassination of Argentine Vice President Cristina Fernández. While Agustina Díaz was detained earlier this week, two others Fernando Sabag Montiel and his girlfriend Brenda Uliarte were arrested shortly after the incident. On September 1, Montiel had pointed a handgun at the vice-president but the gun did not go off.

361.title: How many deaths will it take?: Pope on Russia-Ukraine war
361.article_body: Pope Francis on Wednesday asked "how many deaths will it take" for peace to triumph, as the Russia-Ukraine war nears seven months since its beginning. The Pope was speaking to the Russian Orthodox hierarchy in Kazakhstan when he made the comments, though he did not mention Russia or Ukraine. He said religious leaders must promote peace.

362.title: PM Modi to discuss cooperation under UN with Russian Prez: Kremlin
362.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi will discuss bilateral cooperation with Russian President Vladimir Putin during the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation (SCO) summit in Uzbekistan on September 15 and 16. The two leaders will discuss cooperation within the G20 and the United Nations frameworks, the Kremlin said. Modi is also expected to meet Chinese President Xi Jinping during the summit.

363.title: Vinesh creates history, becomes 1st Indian woman wrestler to win 2 World C'ships medals
363.article_body: Wrestler Vinesh Phogat on Wednesday created history by becoming the first-ever Indian woman wrestler to win at least two medals in World Championships. The 28-year-old defeated Sweden's Jonna Malmgren 8-0 to bag bronze in the 53-kg category at the 2022 World Wrestling Championships in Belgrade. She had bagged her first World Championships medal, a bronze, in 2019.

364.title: Social bonds stretched to polarise voters: Sonia Gandhi
364.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi has alleged constitutional values are under assault in the country with social bonds being deliberately stretched to polarise voters. In an op-ed article in the Hindustan Times, Gandhi wrote power was concentrated over the last eight years in the hands of few politicians. She further said independent authorities were now reduced to "tools of the executive".

365.title: China's Xi meets Kazakh leader on 1st foreign trip since pandemic
365.article_body: Chinese President Xi Jinping visited Kazakhstan on Wednesday which is his first foreign tour since the beginning of the COVID-19 pandemic. Xi met Kazakhstan President Kassym-Jomart Tokayev and the two leaders discussed the energy markets and the global economic situation, according to a statement. Xi's visit to Kazakhstan comes ahead of the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation summit in Uzbekistan.

366.title: William and Harry walk side by side behind Queen Elizabeth's coffin, pic goes viral
366.article_body: Prince William and Prince Harry walked side by side behind their grandmother Queen Elizabeth II's coffin on Wednesday. The brothers were taking part in a procession from Buckingham Palace to Westminster Hall, where the queen's body will lie in state for four days until her funeral. Their father King Charles was in front of them.

367.title: Unarmed policeman attacked with iron rods: TMC's Abhishek on Nabanna march
367.article_body: TMC General Secretary Abhishek Banerjee on Wednesday criticised BJP after a video showing assault on policeman during the party's 'Nabanna Cholo' march went viral on social media. "An unarmed police officer was attacked with iron rods and sticks, police van was set ablaze," Banerjee said. "Police could've fired bullets instead of using teargas...but they chose to show restraint," he added.

368.title: NCC cadet punches bus conductor after row over ticket in MP: Report
368.article_body: An NCC cadet reportedly punched the conductor of a state-run BCLL bus in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal on Tuesday. The incident reportedly took place after the conductor asked the cadet to buy a ticket. A CCTV footage showed the man, who was dressed in a uniform, repeatedly attacking the conductor before getting off the bus.

369.title: Australia's Mitchell Starc, Mitchell Marsh & Marcus Stoinis ruled out of India T20I tour
369.article_body: Australia's Mitchell Starc, Mitchell Marsh and Marcus Stoinis have been ruled out of the upcoming T20I series against India. Starc (knee), Marsh (ankle) and Stoinis (side) have low-level injuries, Cricket Australia said. They have been replaced by Nathan Ellis, Daniel Sams and Sean Abbott. The three-match tour starts in Mohali on September 20.

370.title: Who are the highest-ranked Indian cricketers in the latest rankings?
370.article_body: As per the latest men's cricket rankings, Rishabh Pant is the highest-ranked Indian Test batter, while Ravichandran Ashwin and Ravindra Jadeja are top-ranked Indian bowler and Indian all-rounder, respectively. In ODIs, Virat Kohli is the top-ranked Indian batter, while Suryakumar Yadav is the top-ranked Indian batter in T20Is. Hardik Pandya is the top-ranked Indian all-rounder in ODIs and T20Is.

371.title: Jacqueline grilled for 8 hours in money laundering case, given a list of 100 questions
371.article_body: The Economic Offences Wing of Delhi Police handed over a list of 100 questions to Jacqueline Fernandez in the alleged ₹200 crore scam in the Sukesh Chandrasekhar case. She was under investigation since 11:30 am on Wednesday, which took place for over eight hours. The questions mostly pertained to her relationship with Sukesh and the gifts she received from him.

372.title: Which WI players from last year's T20 WC squad don't feature in T20 WC 2022 squad?
372.article_body: West Indies today announced their squad for the T20 World Cup 2022. As many as 10 players, who were in West Indies' squad for T20 World Cup 2021, don't feature in this year's squad. They are Kieron Pollard, Dwayne Bravo, Andre Fletcher, Ravi Rampaul, Lendl Simmons, Hayden Walsh, Roston Chase, Chris Gayle, Andre Russell and Oshane Thomas.

373.title: Patna ADM removed after video showed him thrashing job aspirant
373.article_body: Patna Additional District Magistrate (Law and Order) KK Singh, who allegedly beat up a teaching job aspirant during a protest last month, was removed from the post on Wednesday. He has been transferred to the General Administration Department in Bihar. A video went viral showing him beating up the teaching job aspirant who was holding the national flag.

374.title: India no.1 in sending students to US colleges & universities: US Embassy India
374.article_body: "India is the number one country for sending students to US colleges and universities," Minister Counsellor for Consular Affairs US Embassy in New Delhi Don Heflin said. "We issued 82,000 student visas this summer...a record for us," he said. According to Open Doors report, there were 1,67,582 students from India in the 2020-2021 academic year in the US.

375.title: Trucking marketplace Raaho looking to raise $20 mn: CEO
375.article_body: Intercity trucking marketplace Raaho is looking to raise $20 million in the next one year to expand its operations in India, Co-founder and Chief Executive Officer Mohammed Imthiaz said. Raaho enables tracking freight in real-time through its technology and Imthiaz added that they are looking to become the largest digital freight marketplace. Raaho raised $1.65 million in 2021.

376.title: Govt to soon invite bids for privatisation of IDBI Bank: DIPAM Secy
376.article_body: Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey on Wednesday said the department would soon invite preliminary bids from investors for the privatisation of IDBI Bank. "It's...first of its kind transaction where through a bidding route we'll be privatising...bank," he said. The government presently holds 45.48% stake in the bank and LIC owns a 49.24% stake.

377.title: Punjab Police files FIR after AAP alleges BJP offering ₹25 cr to MLAs to switch sides
377.article_body: Punjab Police on Wednesday filed a case after AAP alleged that BJP was trying to topple the state government by attempting to poach its MLAs. Punjab Finance Minister Harpal Singh Cheema alleged that BJP has contacted some 7 to 10 of its MLAs in the past week. He added BJP offered them up to ₹25 crore each to switch sides.

378.title: Ukraine claims to discover 'torture chamber' used by Russian troops
378.article_body: Ukraine has claimed to discover a 'torture chamber' used by Russian troops to hold Ukrainian prisoners. The torture chamber was found in the basement of a police station in Balakliya, the Ukrainian city that was recently liberated after being occupied by Russia for more than six months. "The Lord's Prayer was carved on the wall by Ukrainian prisoners," said Ukraine.

379.title: EV startups will disrupt India's automotive market: Amitabh Kant
379.article_body: Former CEO of Niti Aayog Amitabh Kant said that electric vehicle (EV) startups will disrupt India's automotive market, adding that the auto industry needs to reinvent itself as the country transits towards e-mobility. "The market for electrics is going to explode in the days to come," Kant said. He added that Indian startups can shake up the automobile traditional market.

380.title: Will ask other states too: NCPCR on illegal madrassas' survey in UP, Assam
380.article_body: National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) chief Priyank Kanoongo said the statutory body will remind other states to carry out surveys of illegal madrassas, as is being done in UP, Assam and Uttarakhand. "There are no fundamental formal studies that are being imparted. The children were misbehaved with in madrassas, which is also against the Constitution," Kanoongo added.

381.title: Punjab Police ASI arrested for taking ₹2,000 bribe
381.article_body: Assistant Sub-Inspector (ASI) Lakhwinder Singh of Punjab Police was arrested on Wednesday for allegedly taking a bribe of ₹2,000. A resident of Kapurthala had approached Punjab Vigilance Bureau alleging that he had a dispute with his partner at a shop and Singh demanded bribe to help him in the matter. Following the complaint, officials arrested Singh red-handed, a spokesperson said.

382.title: VHP activists make men hold ears & apologise over roadside namaz in UP, video surfaces
382.article_body: Vishva Hindu Parishad activists confronted a group of men who were on their way to Ajmer, making them apologise for offering namaz by the roadside in UP's Shahjahanpur and sending them to the local police station. A video showed some men holding their ears. "They were released after receiving...apology in writing and issuing a challan," a police official said.

383.title: Ready to assist probe: Partha breaks down during hearing in SSC scam case
383.article_body: Ex-West Bengal Minister Partha Chatterjee broke down during his virtual court hearing on Wednesday in the School Service Commission (SSC) recruitment scam case and stated that he's a "victim of political conspiracy". "I'm ready to offer all assistance to the [probe]...Considering my mental...state, please consider my bail," he said. Chatterjee and his aide Arpita Mukherjee were arrested in July.

384.title: Singer Jesse Powell passes away aged 51
384.article_body: Jesse Powell, the singer-songwriter best known for his '90s hit 'You', has died aged 51, his family said in a statement. The Grammy-nominated R&B artist "passed away peacefully" at his home in Los Angeles, according to the statement. Powell's family has not provided details about the circumstances surrounding his death.

385.title: 400-year-old Nayak-era stone inscription found at Tamil Nadu temple
385.article_body: Students and professors of Mannar Thirumalai Naicker College have found a 400-year-old Nayak-era stone inscription at a Vinayagar temple in Theni, Tamil Nadu. The stone has symbols of the Sun, the Moon and a lotus with blurred letters. Retired archaeologist Dr Santhalingam said that the inscriptions talk about a donation by Muthu Veerappa Nayak, a ruler of Madurai Nayak Kingdom.

386.title: Ravindra Jadeja shares pic of him walking on crutches
386.article_body: Cricketer Ravindra Jadeja, who recently underwent knee surgery, took to social media to share a picture of him walking on crutches. He wrote, "One step at a time." Commenting on his post on Instagram, former India batter Suresh Raina wrote, "@ravindra.jadeja get well soon brother! See you soon." Jadeja underwent surgery after being ruled out of Asia Cup 2022 midway.

387.title: West Indies announce their squad for T20 World Cup 2022
387.article_body: West Indies on Wednesday announced their squad for T20 World Cup 2022. The team will be led by Nicholas Pooran, while Rovman Powell has been named vice-captain. Opener Evin Lewis has been recalled for the first time since T20 World Cup 2021. The squad also includes two uncapped players: right-arm leg-spinner allrounder Yannic Cariah and left-arm batting allrounder Raymon Reifer.

388.title: Article 370 was not an obstacle in J&K's development: Azad
388.article_body: Former Congress leader Ghulam Nabi Azad said Article 370 was not an obstacle in the development of Jammu and Kashmir. "I've countered the PM and the Home Minister in Parliament on this issue," Azad said. "I've highlighted 30 indices where Jammu and Kashmir under Article 370 outperformed...national average and 40 indices where it fared better than Gujarat," Azad added.

389.title: 'Moonlighting' not ethically right for full-time employees: IBM's India MD
389.article_body: Sandip Patel, the MD for IBM India/South Asia region, said, "All of our workers when they are employed, they sign an agreement which says that they're going to be working full-time for IBM." He added, "So moonlighting is not ethically right for them to get into." 'Moonlighting' refers to the practice of taking up secondary jobs after regular work hours.

390.title: Audiences have right to reject bad content: Simbu on boycott trend
390.article_body: Actor Simbu, speaking about the ongoing boycott trend against Bollywood films, has said that content decides the "fate" of movies. "I don't think audiences should be blamed because they won't boycott a good film...At the same time, audiences have all the right to reject bad content and we have no say in it," he further stated.

391.title: Govt exercised restraint against violent BJP protestors: Mamata
391.article_body: West Bengal Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee said that the administration exercised "maximum restraint" against the BJP protestors who were violent in their march to the state secretariat. Alleging that the rally participants brutally attacked police personnel, she said, "Police could have opened fire." She also said that the administration has nothing against democratic and peaceful protests.

392.title: PM Narendra Modi will become PM again in 2024: Goa CM Pramod Sawant
392.article_body:
After eight Congress MLAs joined the BJP in Goa, CM Pramod Sawant said, in 2024 under the leadership of PM Narendra Modi, the party will have over 400 MPs from Kanniyakumari to Kashmir.
"PM Narendra Modi will become PM again," Pramod Sawant said. "We are moving forward to make India a world leader," Sawant added.

393.title: Every effort will be made for Agnipath recruitment rallies: Mann
393.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Wednesday extended total support to the Army's Agnipath recruitment rallies, saying "every effort will be made" for the drives. Mann's comments came after an Army zonal officer said there was "lack of support" from local authorities in Punjab. Aam Aadmi Party national convener Arvind Kejriwal on Wednesday said the party will "fully support" the scheme.

394.title: SoftBank considers launching a third Vision Fund: Report
394.article_body: Japan's SoftBank Group is considering launching a third Vision Fund to invest in startups, according to a report. The size of the fund isn't finalised and is likely to see the infusion of its own capital. Last month, SoftBank CEO Masayoshi Son said that the Vision Fund investment arm would be restructured after it reported a $50 billion loss.

395.title: All paramedical institutes in UP to be geo-tagged to curb fraud: Report
395.article_body: UP's State Medical Faculty has reportedly decided that all healthcare facilities attached to para-medical institutes will be geo-tagged. "[During inspection], there are chances that...inspectors...are shown...other well-equipped hospitals to get a better scorecard. [This will be curbed] through geo-tagging," an official said. Nearly 1,200 institutes reportedly offer paramedical courses in UP.

396.title: 2 held as 8 killed in fire at e-bike showroom in Secunderabad
396.article_body: The police have arrested the owners of the Ruby Pride hotel and Gemopai e-bikes showroom after a fire in a building, in Secunderabad, housing the two killed eight people and injured 10 others. CM K Chandrashekar Rao announced ex-gratia of ₹3 lakh. PM Narendra Modi said that ₹2 lakh will be paid to the families of those who died.

397.title: Northeast Frontier Railway turns old train coaches to restaurants
397.article_body: The Northeast Frontier Railway (NFR) has converted old train coaches into restaurants to increase revenue and create jobs. A statement said that NFR has opened two coach restaurants, one at Katihar in Bihar and the other at New Jalpaiguri station in Bengal. With the proliferation of the new LHB coaches, old coaches of the Indian Railways are being phased out.

398.title: 35,000 buses in Karnataka to go electric by 2030: Minister
398.article_body: Karnataka Transport Minister B Sriramulu said the state government is planning to convert 35,000 buses to electric by 2030 keeping in mind environment and pollution related concerns. He added that with the rising costs of diesel, they were incurring losses. The Minister also said that the Bengaluru Metropolitan Transport Corporation (BMTC) is operating electric buses on a contractual basis.

399.title: Eating non-veg food no taboo, can't be banned but avoid beef: RSS leader
399.article_body: RSS leader J Nandakumar said on Wednesday that consumption of non-vegetarian food isn't a taboo and cannot be banned in India. "As per the climate conditions and geographic locations, people do eat such food," Nandakumar said, adding that it's the "staple diet" for a section of the population. Nandakumar, however, added that consumption of beef should be avoided.

400.title: Hindi acts as bridge between different states: Rajasthan CM Gehlot
400.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Wednesday said that Hindi language acts as a bridge between different states of the country. He added that it is an effective medium for the expression of thoughts. Addressing a state-level Hindi Diwas function in Jaipur, Gehlot said that the language has played an important role in increasing the spirit of brotherhood among the countrymen.

401.title: Goldman downgrades Infosys & TCS stocks to 'sell', upgrades Wipro's: Report
401.article_body: Goldman Sachs has reportedly downgraded Indian IT service providers Tata Consultancy Services and Infosys' stock to "sell" from "buy". It cited a potential slowdown in dollar revenue growth in the face of impending macroeconomic stress for downgrading the stock. Meanwhile, it has upgraded Wipro's stock to "buy" from "sell," citing attractive valuations and a recent pickup in Wipro's order book.
